original: byang chub kyi sems ma 'phos pa'i thig le rnams dang mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po'i skad cig rnams kyis yongs su mchod par bya'o zhes pa nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ma 'phos pa'i thig le rnams dang mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po'i skad cig rnams kyis yongs su mchod par bya'o zhes pa nges pa'i don to //
translated: One should worship with the drops of the unmoving mind of enlightenment and the moments of unchanging great bliss.

original: zhes pa dpal kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud la rdo rje'i tshig gi snying po bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel du brtag pa gnyis pa rab gnas kyi le'u ste dang po'o /
analyzed: zhes pa dpal kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud la rdo rje'i tshig gi snying po bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel du brtag pa gnyis pa rab gnas kyi le'u ste dang po'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the second chapter in the Tantra of Sri Hevajra, called “The Well-Sanctified,” a commentary on the vajra words.

original: // / da ni gnyis pa dngos grub kyi le'u gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / da ni gnyis pa dngos grub kyi le'u gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the second chapter, on spiritual powers, is stated.

original: nam mkha' lta bu'i chos kun la //🔽rgya mtsho'i ku ba ji lta bar //🔽sems can rang 'dod lha yi ni //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu'i chos kun la // rgya mtsho'i ku ba ji lta bar // sems can rang 'dod lha yi ni //
translated: All phenomena are like space.🔽How can one accomplish🔽the form of a deity of one’s own desire

original: gzugs kyis ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzugs kyis ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: like a sea monster?

original: zhes pa la sogs pa la nam mkha' lta bu zhes pa ni rang bzhin med pa'i chos thams cad rnam pa ji ltar thog mar rgya mtsho chen por 'phangs pa'i ku ba nyi tshe bar 'gyur ba de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chu srin gyis dkrugs pa'i
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa la nam mkha' lta bu zhes pa ni rang bzhin med pa'i chos thams cad rnam pa ji ltar thog mar rgya mtsho chen por 'phangs pa'i ku ba nyi tshe bar 'gyur ba de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chu srin gyis dkrugs pa'i
translated: The phrase like space in the above passage means that just as a ball thrown into the great ocean will eventually come to rest, so too will sentient beings come to rest in the ocean of cyclic existence, which is churned by the sea monsters of attachment and so on.

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor sems can rnams ji ltar grub par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor sems can rnams ji ltar grub par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: How will they come to rest?

original: dpal dombi'i zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal dombi'i zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
translated: The glorious Dombi Heruka also states:

original: de ltar shes nas srid pa'i rgya mtsho dug gi chu can 'dod chags la sogs chu srin 'khrugs //
analyzed: de ltar shes nas srid pa'i rgya mtsho dug gi chu can 'dod chags la sogs chu srin 'khrugs //
translated: Thus, knowing that the ocean of existence has poisonous waters and is churned by the sea monsters of attachment and so on,

original: nad kyi zug gzer rba rlabs rgyas pas bsgrubs pa'i 'gram nyid gcig pu bde ba chen po ste /
analyzed: nad kyi zug gzer rba rlabs rgyas pas bsgrubs pa'i 'gram nyid gcig pu bde ba chen po ste /
translated: the shore of which is the sole great bliss that is accomplished through the swelling waves of the pain of illness,

original: de phyir skye bo byang chub blo ldan skad cig tsam yang rang gi don la mtha' gcig tu //
analyzed: de phyir skye bo byang chub blo ldan skad cig tsam yang rang gi don la mtha' gcig tu //
translated: how is it that people who are wise in the ways of enlightenment do not strive for their own welfare even for a moment?

original: brtson pa gti mug zhags pa'i phongs pa spangs te yang dag rmad du byung bar mi 'gro'am //
analyzed: brtson pa gti mug zhags pa'i phongs pa spangs te yang dag rmad du byung bar mi 'gro'am //
translated: Have they abandoned the noose of delusion and gone to the perfect and marvelous?

original: zhes so // rang 'dod lha'i gzugs zhes pa dpal gdan bzhi par yang gsungs pa //
analyzed: zhes so // rang 'dod lha'i gzugs zhes pa dpal gdan bzhi par yang gsungs pa //
translated: The form of the deity of one’s desire is also taught in the glorious Four Seats:

original: bdag nyid lha dang pha rol lha //
analyzed: bdag nyid lha dang pha rol lha //
translated: One’s own deity and the deity of the other.

original: bdag nyid lha ni dam pa ste //
analyzed: bdag nyid lha ni dam pa ste //
translated: One’s own deity is the supreme.

original: bdag nyid gzugs su nus med rnams //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzugs su nus med rnams //
translated: Those who are unable to visualize themselves as a deity

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs rnams rtog byed //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs rnams rtog byed //
translated: Should imagine a reflection and so forth.

original: bdag med rnal 'byor ldan pa'am //
analyzed: bdag med rnal 'byor ldan pa'am //
translated: Endowed with the yoga of selflessness

original: yang na he ru ka dpal brtson //
analyzed: yang na he ru ka dpal brtson //
translated: Or else, one should strive to be glorious Heruka.

original: zhes pa la dpal 'dus par gsungs pa yang //
analyzed: zhes pa la dpal 'dus par gsungs pa yang //
translated: The glorious Guhyasamaja also teaches:

original: dngos po 'di rnams ma skyes pa //🔽chos med @121a * //
analyzed: dngos po 'di rnams ma skyes pa // chos med @121a * //
translated: These things are unborn.🔽There are no phenomena.

original: chos nyid kyang med de //
analyzed: chos nyid kyang med de //
translated: There is no reality.

original: nam mkha' lta bur bdag med pa //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur bdag med pa //
translated: Like space, they are selfless.

original: 'di ni byang chub tshul bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub tshul bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the way of teaching enlightenment.

original: zhes so // kye'i rdo rje sems zhes bshad //
analyzed: zhes so // kye'i rdo rje sems zhes bshad //
translated: The Hevajra Tantra also says:

original: rnam rtog med pa'i rang bzhin te //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i rang bzhin te //
translated: The nature of nonconceptuality

original: rang bzhin 'od gsal rnam pa can //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'od gsal rnam pa can //
translated: Is the nature of clear light.

original: gdod nas zhi ba nam mkha' mnyam //🔽zhes so // bsam gtan nyon mongs 'jig byed pa //
analyzed: gdod nas zhi ba nam mkha' mnyam // zhes so // bsam gtan nyon mongs 'jig byed pa //
translated: It is peace from the beginning, equal to space.🔽The same text says:

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: Meditation destroys the afflictions.

original: dpal rdo rje rtse mor gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje rtse mor gsungs pa yang /
translated: The glorious Vajraśekhara teaches:

original: bsam gtan ci yi don brjod bya //
analyzed: bsam gtan ci yi don brjod bya //
translated: What is the purpose of concentration?

original: sdug bsngal thams cad gcod pa dang // nyon mongs dra ba 'jig byed pa //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad gcod pa dang // nyon mongs dra ba 'jig byed pa //
translated: It is to cut through all suffering, to destroy the net of afflictions.

original: shes rab lhan cig bsam gtan ni //
analyzed: shes rab lhan cig bsam gtan ni //
translated: Concentration with wisdom

original: srid pa 'joms par byed pa'i mchog / ces so //
analyzed: srid pa 'joms par byed pa'i mchog / ces so //
translated: is the supreme destroyer of existence.

original: bsam pa thams cad yongs spangs nas //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad yongs spangs nas //
translated: Having completely abandoned all thoughts,

original: lha yi gzugs su sems pa yis //🔽nyin gcig bar chad med pa ru //
analyzed: lha yi gzugs su sems pa yis // nyin gcig bar chad med pa ru //
translated: with a mind that is the form of the deity,🔽meditate without interruption for a day

original: bsgoms nas yongs su brtag par gyis //
analyzed: bsgoms nas yongs su brtag par gyis //
translated: and then examine.

original: zhes pa 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su yang gsungs pa /
translated: The glorious Sarvatathāgatādhiṣṭhāna-śrīparaṃāśāstra also says:

original: rang gi sems ni brgyal dang gnyid la rab zhugs mi yi bdag po rang bzhin med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni brgyal dang gnyid la rab zhugs mi yi bdag po rang bzhin med par 'gyur //
translated: O lord of humans, your mind, having entered deep sleep and faintness, becomes devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: sad la rang bzhin dang bcas gsal byed de rnams srog chags rnams kyi thar pa'i lam ma yin //
analyzed: sad la rang bzhin dang bcas gsal byed de rnams srog chags rnams kyi thar pa'i lam ma yin //
translated: When you awaken, it is clear that it has intrinsic nature, but those are not the liberation path of living beings.

original: dngos dang dngos med kyis phye sems kyi rdo rje rnal 'byor ba la bde mnyam ster ba yin //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med kyis phye sems kyi rdo rje rnal 'byor ba la bde mnyam ster ba yin //
translated: The mind, divided into the real and the unreal, is the giver of the bliss of equality to the Vajrayoga practitioner.

original: nam mkha'i shes rab la 'khyud lhan skyes bde bar gnas pa'i rang sems gang de thar pa ster //
analyzed: nam mkha'i shes rab la 'khyud lhan skyes bde bar gnas pa'i rang sems gang de thar pa ster //
translated: The mind that abides in the innate bliss, embraced by the wisdom of space, is the giver of liberation.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: rgyud ni rgyud gzhan gyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud ni rgyud gzhan gyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The tantra should be understood by means of another tantra.

original: zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment of the Tathagata.

original: dpal phyag na rdo rjes kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal phyag na rdo rjes kyang gsungs pa /
translated: The glorious Vajrapani also said:

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis dam bca' ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis dam bca' ba ni /
translated: Here, the Blessed One's vow is:

original: bsam pa thams cad yongs spangs te /
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad yongs spangs te /
translated: Abandoning all thoughts,

original: nyin gcig yongs su brtag par bya //
analyzed: nyin gcig yongs su brtag par bya //
translated: One should investigate for one day.

original: gal te yid ches ma byung na //
analyzed: gal te yid ches ma byung na //
translated: If there is no conviction,

original: de tshe nga yi brdzun tshig yin //
analyzed: de tshe nga yi brdzun tshig yin //
translated: Then my words are false.

original: zhes pa'o // 'dir yid ches ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'dir yid ches ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: Here, conviction is the sign of smoke and so forth,

original: gzhan sngags la sogs pas nyin gcig bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa gang gis sngags pa rnams kyi yid ches bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan sngags la sogs pas nyin gcig bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa gang gis sngags pa rnams kyi yid ches bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Which is not to be accomplished in one day by others through mantras and so on, by which the minds of the mantra practitioners become convinced.

original: de'i phyir yod pa dang med pa'i blo yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa dang med pa'i blo yongs su spangs te /
translated: Therefore, having completely abandoned the mind of existence and non-existence,

original: rten med par byas nas zab mo stong pa nyid kyi gzhil yid ches su 'gyur te //
analyzed: rten med par byas nas zab mo stong pa nyid kyi gzhil yid ches su 'gyur te //
translated: having made [the mind] without support, one should have confidence in the profound emptiness.

original: bden par yid ches par byed pa yid ches pa'i don du ba la sogs pa rnal 'byor bas shes par bya'o zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: bden par yid ches par byed pa yid ches pa'i don du ba la sogs pa rnal 'byor bas shes par bya'o zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The meaning of confidence is to be known by the yogi/nī as the ascertainment of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: byed pa bcing ba'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: byed pa bcing ba'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: by the practice of binding the agent,

original: sa gsum @121b pa ni bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: sa gsum @121b pa ni bsgrub par bya //
translated: the three worlds are accomplished.

original: zhes pa la sangs rgyas kyi gzugs ni srid pa gsum ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sangs rgyas kyi gzugs ni srid pa gsum ste /
translated: The form of the Buddha is the three worlds.

original: byed pa mig la sogs pa rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa mig la sogs pa rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: It is to be accomplished by the agents, the eyes, etc.

original: man ngag de nyid ni bla ma'i zhal las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: man ngag de nyid ni bla ma'i zhal las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: That instruction is to be understood from the guru’s mouth.

original: dpal mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: dpal mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du gsungs pa yang /
translated: Also, it is taught in the glorious Vajrapañjara:

original: gang dang gang gis 'dul ba yis //
analyzed: gang dang gang gis 'dul ba yis //
translated: By whatever tames

original: sems can gdul bya nyid 'gro ba //
analyzed: sems can gdul bya nyid 'gro ba //
translated: the beings to be tamed,

original: rnam pa de dang de yis ni //
analyzed: rnam pa de dang de yis ni //
translated: by that very method

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa'o //
translated: the buddhas teach the dharma.

original: zhes pa'o // dpal mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas stong phrag bcu gnyis par gsungs pa de nyid la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // dpal mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas stong phrag bcu gnyis par gsungs pa de nyid la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: One should enter into that very [reality] which is taught in the Shri Paramiva Adibuddha Dviidasahasrika.

original: bkab dang ma bkab mig dag gis /
analyzed: bkab dang ma bkab mig dag gis /
translated: With eyes both covered and uncovered,

original: stong par gang zhig rjes brtags min //
analyzed: stong par gang zhig rjes brtags min //
translated: one should not investigate the empty.

original: rmi lam lta bur gzugs brnyan mthong //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bur gzugs brnyan mthong //
translated: Seeing forms like a dream,

original: rtag tu gzugs de bsgom par bya //🔽ji ltar me long pra phab la //
analyzed: rtag tu gzugs de bsgom par bya // ji ltar me long pra phab la //
translated: one should always meditate on that form.🔽Just as a young woman sees in a mirror

original: gzhon nu mas mthong dngos med skyes //
analyzed: gzhon nu mas mthong dngos med skyes //
translated: an unreal thing that is born,

original: de bzhin 'das dang ma 'ongs chos //
analyzed: de bzhin 'das dang ma 'ongs chos //
translated: so the yogi/ni sees the past and future

original: mkha' la de ltar rnal 'byor bas //🔽med pa'i chos can rnams la chos //
analyzed: mkha' la de ltar rnal 'byor bas // med pa'i chos can rnams la chos //
translated: in the sky in that way.🔽The arising of phenomena

original: skye ba 'di ni rab tu mthong //
analyzed: skye ba 'di ni rab tu mthong //
translated: is seen in these non-existent phenomena.

original: yid bzhin nor ltar mtha' yas pa'i //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor ltar mtha' yas pa'i //
translated: Like a wish-fulfilling gem,

original: sems can re ba yongs gang byed //
analyzed: sems can re ba yongs gang byed //
translated: the hopes of sentient beings are fulfilled.

original: pra phab pa yi gzhon nu mas //
analyzed: pra phab pa yi gzhon nu mas //
translated: A young woman in a mirror

original: ma mthong ba yi rdzas mthong byed //
analyzed: ma mthong ba yi rdzas mthong byed //
translated: sees a substance that is not seen.

original: nyi tshe ba yi mig dag gis //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba yi mig dag gis //
translated: The adept sees with limited eyes

original: bsams nas sgrub pa po yis mthong //
analyzed: bsams nas sgrub pa po yis mthong //
translated: after contemplating.

original: zhes so // dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su yang gsungs pa /
translated: And in the Shri-Paramadya also:

original: nam mkhar kun nas zhen pa'i sems dang mig ni mi 'dzums rdo rje'i lam du rab zhugs pas //
analyzed: nam mkhar kun nas zhen pa'i sems dang mig ni mi 'dzums rdo rje'i lam du rab zhugs pas //
translated: By the mind and eye fixed in space, and by the vajra path of the eye not closed,

original: stong pa las ni du ba smig rgyu rab gsal dri med mkha' snang nyid dang mar me dang // 'bar ba zla ba nyi ma rdo rje rnams dang mchog gi cha dang thig le mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa las ni du ba smig rgyu rab gsal dri med mkha' snang nyid dang mar me dang // 'bar ba zla ba nyi ma rdo rje rnams dang mchog gi cha dang thig le mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: From the void, smoke, mirage, clear and stainless light in the sky, a lamp, a blazing fire, the moon, the sun, the vajra, the supreme part, and the drop are seen.

original: de yi dbus su sangs rgyas gzugs ni yul dang rnam bral du ma longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
analyzed: de yi dbus su sangs rgyas gzugs ni yul dang rnam bral du ma longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
translated: In the middle of that, the form of the Buddha, free from objects, is the sambhogakaya.

original: nam mkha' chu 'dzin bral ba rnal 'byor ba yis bgrad pa'i mig gis blta bar bya ba ste //
analyzed: nam mkha' chu 'dzin bral ba rnal 'byor ba yis bgrad pa'i mig gis blta bar bya ba ste //
translated: The yogi should look with wide-open eyes at the sky free from clouds.

original: re kh'a nag po dri med 'od zer 'pho ba dus kyi rtsa la mthong gi bar du'o der //
analyzed: re kh'a nag po dri med 'od zer 'pho ba dus kyi rtsa la mthong gi bar du'o der //
translated: Until the black line, the stainless light-ray, is seen in the channel of time.

original: kun mkhyen gzugs ni chu la nyi ma lta bu gos pa med pa kha dog sna tshogs te //
analyzed: kun mkhyen gzugs ni chu la nyi ma lta bu gos pa med pa kha dog sna tshogs te //
translated: The form of the Omniscient One, like the sun in the water, is unattached, multicolored,

original: rnam pa kun ldan rang sems yul dang rnam par bral ba'o sems ni gzhan pa min pa nyid //
analyzed: rnam pa kun ldan rang sems yul dang rnam par bral ba'o sems ni gzhan pa min pa nyid //
translated: The mind is not other than that, endowed with all aspects, free from objects and aspects.

original: ces so // 'dir brtan par byed pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ces so // 'dir brtan par byed pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, stability is taught.

original: dpal shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: dpal shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gsungs pa yang /
translated: Also, it is stated in the glorious Perfection of Wisdom:

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces @122a * //
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces @122a * //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said this to the venerable Subhūti:

original: smras so // 'phags pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin /
analyzed: smras so // 'phags pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, who is engaged in the yoga of the perfection of wisdom?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: koo'u shi ka gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa de ni nam mkha' la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: koo'u shi ka gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa de ni nam mkha' la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
translated: “Kauśika, one who is engaged in the yoga of the perfection of wisdom is engaged in the yoga of space.

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya bar sems pa de ni bla gab med pa la rnal 'byor du byed do zhes so //
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya bar sems pa de ni bla gab med pa la rnal 'byor du byed do zhes so //
translated: One who thinks, ‘I will train in the perfection of wisdom,’ is engaged in the yoga of the open sky.”

original: 'dir bla ma'i man ngag gis nam mkha' la thog mar rnal 'byor bas du ba mthong ste /
analyzed: 'dir bla ma'i man ngag gis nam mkha' la thog mar rnal 'byor bas du ba mthong ste /
translated: Here, through the guru's instruction, the yogi first sees smoke in the sky,

original: smig rgyu ni ma yin no zhes pa rang gi nyams su myong ba las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu ni ma yin no zhes pa rang gi nyams su myong ba las shes par bya'o //
translated: and not a mirage. This should be understood from one's own experience.

original: de ltar du ba ni mtshan ma dang po'o //
analyzed: de ltar du ba ni mtshan ma dang po'o //
translated: Thus, smoke is the first sign.

original: smig rgyu ni mtshan ma gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu ni mtshan ma gnyis pa'o //
translated: A mirage is the second sign.

original: mkha' snang ni mtshan ma gsum pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' snang ni mtshan ma gsum pa'o //
translated: An appearance in the sky is the third sign.

original: sgron ma ni mtshan ma bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: sgron ma ni mtshan ma bzhi pa'o //
translated: A lamp is the fourth sign.

original: mtshan ma lnga pa ni sprin med pa'i nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma lnga pa ni sprin med pa'i nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: The fifth sign is like a cloudless sky.

original: zhes dpal 'dus pa dang mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes dpal 'dus pa dang mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is taught by the Bhagavān in the glorious Guhyasamāja and the Vajra Tent of the Ḍākinīs.

original: dngos grub pa 'di kun rgyu dang bcas //
analyzed: dngos grub pa 'di kun rgyu dang bcas //
translated: All of these accomplishments are with causes.

original: dngos grub nye bar 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub nye bar 'grub pa'o //
translated: Accomplishments are accomplished.

original: phyi nas sgyu ma'i rnam pa ste //
analyzed: phyi nas sgyu ma'i rnam pa ste //
translated: Later, there is the aspect of illusion,

original: rmi lam rnam par skad cig re //
analyzed: rmi lam rnam par skad cig re //
translated: and the dream is momentary.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su gsungs pa yang //
analyzed: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su gsungs pa yang //
translated: It is also taught in the glorious Sarvatathāgatātaḥ

original: khro bo sangs rgyas lha mo dang bcas nges par ro yi rdo rje rnams dang sa snying sogs //
analyzed: khro bo sangs rgyas lha mo dang bcas nges par ro yi rdo rje rnams dang sa snying sogs //
translated: The wrathful ones, the Buddhas, and the Goddesses, certainly Vajra-Rohi, and Kshitigarbha, and so on,

original: rab tu dga' ba'i thugs rnams rnal 'byor pa la grub pa'i dus su mkha' la mngon sum 'gyur //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i thugs rnams rnal 'byor pa la grub pa'i dus su mkha' la mngon sum 'gyur //
translated: the minds of the greatly joyful ones, manifest in the sky at the time of the yogi's accomplishment.

original: de yi 'dod pa'i dngos grub ri bong can zhag tho rangs dang ni mtshan mo phyed la 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi 'dod pa'i dngos grub ri bong can zhag tho rangs dang ni mtshan mo phyed la 'gyur //
translated: His desired accomplishments, at the break of dawn and midnight, are like the moon.

original: rin po che'am me tog char ba mchog gyur dus kyi sbyor bas sa steng du 'bab 'gyur /
analyzed: rin po che'am me tog char ba mchog gyur dus kyi sbyor bas sa steng du 'bab 'gyur /
translated: A supreme rain of jewels or flowers falls on the earth by the yoga of time.

original: lus ni dang zhing rdul phran nyams pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs mtshan sogs rnams kyis rab rdzogs 'gyur //
analyzed: lus ni dang zhing rdul phran nyams pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs mtshan sogs rnams kyis rab rdzogs 'gyur //
translated: The body is pure, the dust is gone, it is like the sky, and it is fully perfected with the major and minor marks.

original: sna tshogs 'jig rten gsum po rnams ni dang zhing sgrib pa rnam bral rmi lam bzhin du snang /
analyzed: sna tshogs 'jig rten gsum po rnams ni dang zhing sgrib pa rnam bral rmi lam bzhin du snang /
translated: The various three worlds are pure, free from obscurations, and appear like a dream.

original: skad ni kun nas tshad med du ma'i skad gzhan rnams kyis gzhan gyi snying la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: skad ni kun nas tshad med du ma'i skad gzhan rnams kyis gzhan gyi snying la 'jug pa ste /
translated: The voice is immeasurable, and with many other languages it enters the hearts of others.

original: sems ni dam ba'i bde bas gang zhig mi g-yo thams cad dus su lhan cig skyes pas 'khyud //
analyzed: sems ni dam ba'i bde bas gang zhig mi g-yo thams cad dus su lhan cig skyes pas 'khyud //
translated: The mind is filled with the bliss of the ultimate, and is embraced by the innate at all times without wavering.

original: ces so // gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: ces so // gsungs pa yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: 'di la ye shes 'khrul pa med //
analyzed: 'di la ye shes 'khrul pa med //
translated: Here there is no error of wisdom.

original: 'di la 'khrul pa rigs ma yin //
analyzed: 'di la 'khrul pa rigs ma yin //
translated: Here error is not a possibility.

original: sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul bsam mi khyab //
translated: The miracles of the Buddha are inconceivable.

original: yid la mi byed pas kyang 'thob //
analyzed: yid la mi byed pas kyang 'thob //
translated: They are attained by non-mentation.

original: ces so // de bzhin du dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: ces so // de bzhin du dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su gsungs pa yang /
translated: And similarly, the Shri Paramardista states:

original: dpal ldan zla ba chu @122b shel rnam rtog med pa'i rang bzhin las ni chu 'dzag pa'i //
analyzed: dpal ldan zla ba chu @122b shel rnam rtog med pa'i rang bzhin las ni chu 'dzag pa'i //
translated: The glorious moon, the nature of which is free from conceptuality, causes water to fall.

original: de bzhin 'jig rten du ni rgyal ba'i bdag po'i phung po la brten kun mkhyen chos 'byung ste //
analyzed: de bzhin 'jig rten du ni rgyal ba'i bdag po'i phung po la brten kun mkhyen chos 'byung ste //
translated: In the same way, in the world, the Dharma of the Omniscient One arises in dependence on the aggregates of the Victorious One.

original: chu ni sa bon khams la kun du brten nas ro mnyam 'gyur ba ji bzhin nyid du chos //
analyzed: chu ni sa bon khams la kun du brten nas ro mnyam 'gyur ba ji bzhin nyid du chos //
translated: The Dharma is like water, which becomes of one taste in dependence on the elements of the seed.

original: sems can rnams kyi dag pa'i sems kyis rnams mang 'gyur te sngon gyi las kyi mthu las so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi dag pa'i sems kyis rnams mang 'gyur te sngon gyi las kyi mthu las so //
translated: The minds of sentient beings become pure through the power of previous karma.

original: zhes so // 'jigs smyo de bzhin sdug bsngal dang // mya ngan gdung sogs nyer 'tshe dang // 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ches //
analyzed: zhes so // 'jigs smyo de bzhin sdug bsngal dang // mya ngan gdung sogs nyer 'tshe dang // 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ches //
translated: passion, aggression, and stupidity,

original: sgrub pa po nyid nyon mi mongs //
analyzed: sgrub pa po nyid nyon mi mongs //
translated: do not afflict the practitioner.

original: zhes pa'i tshig 'di rgyas par bshad pa ni dpal mtshan yang dag par brjod par gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig 'di rgyas par bshad pa ni dpal mtshan yang dag par brjod par gsungs pa /
translated: The extensive explanation of these words is stated in the Glorious Praise in Honor of the Thirty-Four:

original: sman pa che mchog gtso bo ste //
analyzed: sman pa che mchog gtso bo ste //
translated: The supreme, great physician,

original: zug rngu 'byin pa bla na med //
analyzed: zug rngu 'byin pa bla na med //
translated: the unsurpassed remover of pain,

original: sman rnams ma lus ljon pa'i shing //
analyzed: sman rnams ma lus ljon pa'i shing //
translated: the tree of all medicines,

original: nyon mongs nad kyi dgra che ba //
analyzed: nyon mongs nad kyi dgra che ba //
translated: the great enemy of the disease of afflictions.

original: zhes so // phyag rgya che ge mo khyer la //
analyzed: zhes so // phyag rgya che ge mo khyer la //
translated: Take this great seal,

original: sems can don gyi rdo rje 'dzin //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: sems can don gyi rdo rje 'dzin // zhes pa la /
translated: the vajra holder for the sake of sentient beings.

original: rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa yang //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa yang //
translated: In another tantra it is said:

original: kun mkhyen bde ster de nyid gcig pu rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyag rgya chen mo ste //
analyzed: kun mkhyen bde ster de nyid gcig pu rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyag rgya chen mo ste //
translated: The single omniscient one, the giver of bliss, the sole vajra holder, the great seal,

original: phung po la sogs sgrib pas rab dman yul can gang zhig pra phab brgyad lta bu //
analyzed: phung po la sogs sgrib pas rab dman yul can gang zhig pra phab brgyad lta bu //
translated: whose object is obscured by the aggregates and so forth, is like the eight types of clairvoyance.

original: de bor sangs rgyas nyid ched nor chags 'khyog po'i snying can ma dang brtags ma la //
analyzed: de bor sangs rgyas nyid ched nor chags 'khyog po'i snying can ma dang brtags ma la //
translated: Having lost that, the one who is crooked-hearted, attached to wealth, and who has a false conception of the mother,

original: gang gis rten byed rnam brtags blo can de yis de yang 'pho ba thob par byed //
analyzed: gang gis rten byed rnam brtags blo can de yis de yang 'pho ba thob par byed //
translated: the one who is intelligent and makes use of the examination, he will also attain the transference.

original: 'dod chags nyams la sdig ste gang phyir shin tu sdug ma la ni zhe sdang ste //
analyzed: 'dod chags nyams la sdig ste gang phyir shin tu sdug ma la ni zhe sdang ste //
translated: Because of the decline of passion, there is sin; because of the extreme attachment to the mother, there is anger.

original: sdang las gti mug 'di las rang gi rdo rje lhung las sems ni rtag brgyal te //
analyzed: sdang las gti mug 'di las rang gi rdo rje lhung las sems ni rtag brgyal te //
translated: From anger, there is delusion; from this, the self-vajra falls, and the mind is always unconscious.🔽Engaged in the objects of eating, drinking, and so forth, which are not the supreme and the best,

original: ma lus mchog min bza' dang btung ba la sogs yul can la ni rab tu 'jug / de yis sems la co dris bde ba bcom zhing skye ba drug tu 'khor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ma lus mchog min bza' dang btung ba la sogs yul can la ni rab tu 'jug / de yis sems la co dris bde ba bcom zhing skye ba drug tu 'khor bar 'gyur //
translated: it disturbs the mind, destroys bliss, and one will wander in the six existences.

original: zhes so // slar yang de nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // slar yang de nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: Again, it is said in the same text:🔽The mind that is in accord with the illusion of the consort, in the sky,

original: phyag rgya sgyu ma'i rjes su mthun pa'i yid dang nam mkha' la ni me long la gzugs bzhin //
analyzed: phyag rgya sgyu ma'i rjes su mthun pa'i yid dang nam mkha' la ni me long la gzugs bzhin //
translated: like a form in a mirror,

original: 'jig rten gsum po snang bar byed cing dri med glog mtshungs 'od zer du ma 'phro bar byed //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po snang bar byed cing dri med glog mtshungs 'od zer du ma 'phro bar byed //
translated: illuminates the three worlds and radiates many stainless light rays that are like lightning.

original: phyi dang lus la dbyer med yul dang bral ba snang ba tsam ni mkha' gnas pa'i //
analyzed: phyi dang lus la dbyer med yul dang bral ba snang ba tsam ni mkha' gnas pa'i //
translated: Inseparable from the outer and the body, free from objects, merely appearing, abiding in space,

original: sems la sems kyis bdag gis 'khyud de 'gro ba du ma'i gzugs kyi don ni gzugs su'o //
analyzed: sems la sems kyis bdag gis 'khyud de 'gro ba du ma'i gzugs kyi don ni gzugs su'o //
translated: The mind is embraced by the mind, the meaning of the form of many migrating beings is in the form.

original: zhes so // rdo rje snying pos gsol pa /
analyzed: zhes so // rdo rje snying pos gsol pa /
translated: Vajra garbha asked:

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor kyis //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor kyis //
translated: By the yoga of the completion stage,

original: dam pa'i bde ba bde chen na //
analyzed: dam pa'i bde ba bde chen na //
translated: The supreme bliss, great bliss,

original: rdzogs pa sgom pa med pa ste //
analyzed: rdzogs pa sgom pa med pa ste //
translated: Is the non-meditation of completion.

original: bskyed pa yis ni dgos pa ci //🔽zhes pa la de la rdzogs pa'i @123a * //
analyzed: bskyed pa yis ni dgos pa ci // zhes pa la de la rdzogs pa'i @123a * //
translated: What is the purpose of the generation stage?

original: rim pa zhes bya ba rtogs pa dang dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rim pa zhes bya ba rtogs pa dang dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba dang bral ba ste /
translated: In that regard, what is called the completion stage is free from the bliss of both the object and the sense faculty.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas ster bar byed pa yin na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas ster bar byed pa yin na de'i phyir /
translated: Since that itself bestows buddhahood,🔽What is the purpose of generating the complete maṇḍala

original: rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa dang // phyag rgya bskyed pas dgos pa ci //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa dang // phyag rgya bskyed pas dgos pa ci //
translated: And generating the mudra?

original: zhes pa'o // tshig 'di gsan nas bcom ldan 'das kye'i rdo rjes bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // tshig 'di gsan nas bcom ldan 'das kye'i rdo rjes bka' stsal pa /
translated: Having heard these words, Bhagavān Hevajra replied:

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'di //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'di //
translated: “This great bodhisattva

original: ae ma dad pa'i shugs kyis nyams //
analyzed: ae ma dad pa'i shugs kyis nyams //
translated: Alas! The power of faith is lost.🔽

original: zhes pa kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: zhes pa kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: This is so in terms of the relative.🔽

original: lus kyi dngos med ga las bde //
analyzed: lus kyi dngos med ga las bde //
translated: The body is not an entity; from where can there be bliss?

original: bde ba smra bar mi nus so //🔽khyab bya khyab byed ngo bo yis //
analyzed: bde ba smra bar mi nus so // khyab bya khyab byed ngo bo yis //
translated: It is not possible to speak of bliss.

original: bde bas 'gro ba khyab pa'o //🔽ji ltar me tog la gnas dri //
analyzed: bde bas 'gro ba khyab pa'o // ji ltar me tog la gnas dri //
translated: The pervasion of the world by bliss is by the nature of the pervasion of the pervaded and the pervader.

original: me tog dngos med las mi rtogs //
analyzed: me tog dngos med las mi rtogs //
translated: Just as the scent that resides in a flower is not imagined to be from a nonentity flower,

original: de bzhin gzugs sogs dngos med pas //
analyzed: de bzhin gzugs sogs dngos med pas //
translated: in the same way, because form and so on are not nonentities,

original: bde ba dmigs pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bde ba dmigs pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: bliss is not imagined to be nonexistent.

original: zhes pa kun rdzob kyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa kun rdzob kyis so //
translated: This is the relative.

original: rgyud 'di nyid du slar yang don dam pas 'gog pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyud 'di nyid du slar yang don dam pas 'gog pa 'di lta ste /
translated: In this very tantra, the ultimate is refuted as follows:

original: dngos po dngos po med pa nga  //
analyzed: dngos po dngos po med pa nga  //
translated: I am not an entity or a nonentity.

original: zhes pa rnam pa thams cad pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: zhes pa rnam pa thams cad pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: This is the wisdom of all aspects.

original: dngos po rtogs phyir sangs rgyas nga //
analyzed: dngos po rtogs phyir sangs rgyas nga //
translated: Because of realizing entities, I am the Buddha.

original: zhes pa mngon par shes pa drug can thabs so //
analyzed: zhes pa mngon par shes pa drug can thabs so //
translated: This is the method of the one with the six superknowledges.

original: rmongs pa gang rnams nga mi shes //
analyzed: rmongs pa gang rnams nga mi shes //
translated: Those who are confused do not know me.

original: 'di ltar gyur pa'i gang zhig le los bcom pas kyang ste de rnams ni dbang po gnyis kyi bde bas nye bar bcom pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gyur pa'i gang zhig le los bcom pas kyang ste de rnams ni dbang po gnyis kyi bde bas nye bar bcom pa rnams so //
translated: In this way, those who are overcome by laziness, who are overcome by the pleasure of the two organs,

original: 'dir khams gsum pa rgyu ba dang bcas pa'am mi rgyu ba dang bcas pa'i 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang ltar byung ba la khyab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'dir khams gsum pa rgyu ba dang bcas pa'am mi rgyu ba dang bcas pa'i 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang ltar byung ba la khyab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Here, because of pervading the past, future, and present, with and without movement in the three realms,

original: gal te sangs rgyas kyi ye shes lus las skyes rten dang pa brten pa'i 'brel pas ji ltar me tog las skyes pa'i dri lta bu yin na de med pa na yang 'jig ste /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas kyi ye shes lus las skyes rten dang pa brten pa'i 'brel pas ji ltar me tog las skyes pa'i dri lta bu yin na de med pa na yang 'jig ste /
translated: If the wisdom of the Buddha arises from the body, it would be related as a support and supported, like the smell that arises from a flower. If that does not exist, it would also perish.

original: ji ltar me tog med pa na dri lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar me tog med pa na dri lta bu yin no //
translated: Like the smell that does not exist when the flower does not exist.

original: de lta yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so.

original: de'i phyir phyi dang lus la khyab par byas nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi dang lus la khyab par byas nas /
translated: Therefore, having pervaded the external and the body,

original: phyi la gnas pa lus la gnas pa zhes brjod kyi //🔽lus med na de med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi la gnas pa lus la gnas pa zhes brjod kyi // lus med na de med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The external is called abiding in the body.🔽But it is not that it does not exist when the body does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir de'i phyir lus skyes min zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i phyir lus skyes min zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: For that reason, it is certain that it is not born from the body.

original: de skad du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: ji ltar bum pa zhig gyur kyang //
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa zhig gyur kyang //
translated: Even though a pot is destroyed,

original: nam mkha' la ni 'jig pa med //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni 'jig pa med //
translated: space is not destroyed.

original: de bzhin lus ni zhig gyur kyang //
analyzed: de bzhin lus ni zhig gyur kyang //
translated: In the same way, even though the body is destroyed,

original: ye shes la ni 'jig pa med //
analyzed: ye shes la ni 'jig pa med //
translated: pristine cognition is not destroyed.

original: rang bzhin kho na mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: rang bzhin kho na mya ngan 'das //
translated: The nature itself is nirvana,

original: rnam dag rnam pa'i sems las so //
analyzed: rnam dag rnam pa'i sems las so //
translated: from the mind that is pure in every way.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: dpal shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgya byin gyi le'ur yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgya byin gyi le'ur yang gsungs pa /
translated: In the glorious Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, in the chapter on Śatakratu, it says:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: The venerable Subhūti said:

original: @123b lha'i bu de gal te mya ngan las 'das pa las ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan 'ga' zhig yod na de yang kho bo ni sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o zhes smra'o //
analyzed: @123b lha'i bu de gal te mya ngan las 'das pa las ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan 'ga' zhig yod na de yang kho bo ni sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o zhes smra'o //
translated: “Divine son, if there were any other phenomenon that was superior to nirvana, I would say that it is like an illusion, like a dream.”

original: lha'i bu rnams de ltar sgyu ma dang mya ngan 'das pa 'di ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: lha'i bu rnams de ltar sgyu ma dang mya ngan 'das pa 'di ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: “Divine son, in this way, illusion and nirvana are not two, they cannot be made two.”

original: de ltar rmi lam dang mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar rmi lam dang mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes so //
translated: Thus, dream and nirvana are not two, nor are they divided.

original: lha'i gzugs kyi rnal 'byor ni //
analyzed: lha'i gzugs kyi rnal 'byor ni //
translated: The yoga of the divine form

original: skyes zin tsam la rnam par gnas //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: skyes zin tsam la rnam par gnas // zhes pa la /
translated: is just born and abides.

original: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su gsungs pa yang /
translated: In this regard, it is also stated in the Shri Paramattha-jñana:

original: mngal du yang dag dag pa'i sku ste btsa' ba'i dus nas so ni skyes pa'ang chos kyi'o //
analyzed: mngal du yang dag dag pa'i sku ste btsa' ba'i dus nas so ni skyes pa'ang chos kyi'o //
translated: The body of complete purification is in the womb, and the Dharma is born at the time of birth.

original: so ni rab tu ltung bar gyur ba mi yi bdag po rgyal ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
analyzed: so ni rab tu ltung bar gyur ba mi yi bdag po rgyal ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
translated: The body of enjoyment of the Victorious One, the lord of men, is when the teeth fall out.

original: de nas sprul pa'i sku ni rab tu gsal zhing nges par 'chi ba'i mtshams te mi rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de nas sprul pa'i sku ni rab tu gsal zhing nges par 'chi ba'i mtshams te mi rnams kyi'o //
translated: Then, the emanation body is clearly manifest, and the limit of death is for men.

original: mngal dang phyi rol dag tu slar yang 'di ni ye shes rnam shes dbye bas rnam bzhir 'gyur //🔽zhes so // 'on kyang bag chags phal pas so //
analyzed: mngal dang phyi rol dag tu slar yang 'di ni ye shes rnam shes dbye bas rnam bzhir 'gyur // zhes so // 'on kyang bag chags phal pas so //
translated: In the womb and externally, this is again fourfold by the division of wisdom and consciousness.

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: However, it is by ordinary habitual tendencies.

original: phal pa zhes pa ni bde ba chen po dad gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'pho ba las phal ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: phal pa zhes pa ni bde ba chen po dad gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'pho ba las phal ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The ordinary is said to be the bodhicitta that moves from the single taste of the merger of great bliss and emptiness.

original: chags pas 'jig rten 'ching 'gyur te //
analyzed: chags pas 'jig rten 'ching 'gyur te //
translated: The world is bound by attachment;

original: chags pa nyid kyis rnam grol 'gyur //
analyzed: chags pa nyid kyis rnam grol 'gyur //
translated: it is liberated by attachment.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: And so on.

original: rgyud gzhan du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan du yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also stated in the Tantra of the Other:

original: chags pa nyid dang chags bral yang //
analyzed: chags pa nyid dang chags bral yang //
translated: Attachment and nonattachment

translated: The queens are the goddesses such as Locanā.

original: de rnams dbyer med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis 'jug par gang gi tshe 'gyur ba de'i tshe //
analyzed: de rnams dbyer med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis 'jug par gang gi tshe 'gyur ba de'i tshe //
translated: When one enters through the yoga of their inseparability,

original: btsun mo thams cad dga' bar byed pa kho na'o zhes so //
analyzed: btsun mo thams cad dga' bar byed pa kho na'o zhes so //
translated: He alone delights all the queens.

original: dogs pa med pa'i sems kyis ni //
analyzed: dogs pa med pa'i sems kyis ni //
translated: With a mind free of doubt,

original: zhes pa ji lta bar bcom ldan @127a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ji lta bar bcom ldan @127a * //
translated: just as it is, the Blessed One🔽the vajra of the mind of enlightenment,🔽by being non-different from the senses,🔽abides in the aspect of great bliss,

original: 'das byang chub kyi sems rdo rje ni dbang po rnams dang lhan cig tha mi dad pa nyid kyis na bde ba chen po'i rnam pas bya ba med pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'das byang chub kyi sems rdo rje ni dbang po rnams dang lhan cig tha mi dad pa nyid kyis na bde ba chen po'i rnam pas bya ba med pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: without activity.🔽At that time,

original: de'i tshe / dogs pa med pa'i sems kyis ni //
analyzed: de'i tshe / dogs pa med pa'i sems kyis ni //
translated: with a mind free of doubt,

original: zhes pa'o // bshes la sdug par mi bya zhing /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // bshes la sdug par mi bya zhing /
translated: one should not delight in friends,

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: bshes ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: bshes ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: Friends are the nature of the mind of enlightenment.

original: de la rang bzhin med pas na sdug par mi bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin med pas na sdug par mi bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Since they are without intrinsic nature, one should not delight in them.

original: de bzhin sdang la sdang ba min //
analyzed: de bzhin sdang la sdang ba min //
translated: Likewise, one should not hate enemies.

original: zhes pa sdang ba mig la sogs pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa sdang ba mig la sogs pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: Enemies are the consciousnesses of the eyes and so on.🔽One should not hate them.

original: de la sdang bar bya ba ma yin zhes pa dbyer med pa'i rnal 'byor las so //
analyzed: de la sdang bar bya ba ma yin zhes pa dbyer med pa'i rnal 'byor las so //
translated: The yoga of indivisibility.

original: rdo shing 'jim pa'i rang bzhin gyi //
analyzed: rdo shing 'jim pa'i rang bzhin gyi //
translated: The nature of stone, wood, and clay,

original: lha 'di rnams la phyag mi bya //
analyzed: lha 'di rnams la phyag mi bya //
translated: One should not bow to these deities.

original: zhes pa gang gi tshe /
analyzed: zhes pa gang gi tshe /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: sems kyi rdo rje dbang po rnams thams cad kyi ye shes kyi rgyur byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par gnas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe shing dang rdo ba la sogs pa la phyag mi bya'o zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rdo rje dbang po rnams thams cad kyi ye shes kyi rgyur byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par gnas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe shing dang rdo ba la sogs pa la phyag mi bya'o zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: When the mind-vajra is made the cause of the intuition of all the sense organs, and is situated in the nature of the mandala circle, then one should not bow to trees, stones, and so on.

original: 'gro ba thams cad bsgom par bya //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad bsgom par bya //
translated: One should meditate on all beings.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa la gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa la gsungs pa yang /
translated: And so on.

original: bde ba chen pos 'gro ba khyab //
analyzed: bde ba chen pos 'gro ba khyab //
translated: The world is pervaded by great bliss.

original: bde ba spangs nas rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: bde ba spangs nas rtogs ma yin //
translated: Without bliss, there is no realization.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' dang // mkha' 'gro ma dang btsun mo bzang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' dang // mkha' 'gro ma dang btsun mo bzang //
translated: Buddhas, bodhisattvas, dakinis, and excellent queens,

original: sangs rgyas lnga dang du ma rnams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga dang du ma rnams //
translated: the five Buddhas and the many,🔽are pervaded by bliss.

original: de bzhin bde bas sangs rgyas gshegs //
analyzed: de bzhin bde bas sangs rgyas gshegs //
translated: The Buddhas go forth by means of bliss.

original: tha mal nga rgyal gzhom don du //
analyzed: tha mal nga rgyal gzhom don du //
translated: In order to conquer the pride of ordinary people,

original: sgom pa yang dag rab tu bsgrags //
analyzed: sgom pa yang dag rab tu bsgrags //
translated: meditation is proclaimed.

original: tha mal gnas skabs gzhom ched du //
analyzed: tha mal gnas skabs gzhom ched du //
translated: In order to conquer the state of ordinary people,

original: sgom pa bsgom pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: sgom pa bsgom pa nyid ma yin //
translated: meditation is not meditation.

original: zhes so // dpal kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud la rdo rje'i tshig gi snying po bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel du dgongs pa'i skad kyi le'u ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: zhes so // dpal kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud la rdo rje'i tshig gi snying po bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel du dgongs pa'i skad kyi le'u ste gsum pa'o /
translated: In the Shri Heruka Tantra, the chapter on the language of intention is the third, the commentary on the condensed essence of the vajra words.

original: // / da ni spyod pa'i le'ur gang mdor bstan pa'i glu dang gar la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa'i ched du rgyud thams cad kyi phyag rgya bsdus pa'i don gyi le'u gsungs so //
analyzed: // / da ni spyod pa'i le'ur gang mdor bstan pa'i glu dang gar la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa'i ched du rgyud thams cad kyi phyag rgya bsdus pa'i don gyi le'u gsungs so //
translated: Now, in order to extensively teach the song, dance, and so forth that were briefly presented in the chapter on conduct, the chapter on the meaning of the collected seals of all tantras is presented.

original: dang por re zhig glu bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dang por re zhig glu bstan par bya ste /
translated: First, the song should be taught.

original: kolla ai ri tthi aa bo la zhes pa 'di yis te /
analyzed: kolla ai ri tthi aa bo la zhes pa 'di yis te /
translated: With kollā iri tthi ava bola, it is this.

original: bo la ni rdo rje byang chub kyi sems su bshad do //
analyzed: bo la ni rdo rje byang chub kyi sems su bshad do //
translated: Bola is explained as the vajra bodhicitta.

original: ko zhes bya ba bde ba'o //🔽lla ai re bzung nas so //
analyzed: ko zhes bya ba bde ba'o // lla ai re bzung nas so //
translated: Ko is bliss.🔽Having taken up llā iri, tthi is the abode, the bodhicitta vajra.

original: tthi ya zhes pa gnas so ste byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'o zhes pa 'di yis kolla ai re tthi aa zhes pa po la'i sgra yis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tthi ya zhes pa gnas so ste byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'o zhes pa 'di yis kolla ai re tthi aa zhes pa po la'i sgra yis brjod par bya'o //
translated: With this, kollā iri tthi ava should be expressed with the sound of bola.

original: mu mmu ni re ka ko la /
analyzed: mu mmu ni re ka ko la /
translated: Mummumu ni re kakola.

original: zhes pa la mu mmu ni re'i sgra yis lte ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: zhes pa la mu mmu ni re'i sgra yis lte ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The word mūla means the circle of the navel.

original: ka kko la ni padma'o //
analyzed: ka kko la ni padma'o //
translated: Kakkola is the lotus.

original: des na padma'i @127b chags pas byang chub kyi sems rdo rje la 'khyud par byas pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na padma'i @127b chags pas byang chub kyi sems rdo rje la 'khyud par byas pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, embracing the vajra of bodhicitta means embracing the lotus.

original: gha nkra bi tta ho b'a dzdza ai ka ru ne ki aa ai na ro l'a zhes pa la gha na ni rgyun ma chad par ro //
analyzed: gha nkra bi tta ho b'a dzdza ai ka ru ne ki aa ai na ro l'a zhes pa la gha na ni rgyun ma chad par ro //
translated: Ghanakṛtavittahovajja i karune ki anarola. Ghanakṛta means uninterrupted.

original: kri pi tta ni rdo rje bsgul ba'o //
analyzed: kri pi tta ni rdo rje bsgul ba'o //
translated: Kṛtavitta means shaking the vajra.

original: ka ru na ni zhu ba'i rnam pa 'jig rten gsum gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: ka ru na ni zhu ba'i rnam pa 'jig rten gsum gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Karuna means melting, holding the nature of the three worlds.

original: 'on kyang byang chub gyi sems thams cad kyi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub gyi sems thams cad kyi rdo rje'o //
translated: However, it is the vajra of all bodhicittas.

original: des na po la dbang po gnyis bsrubs pas rol ni tshogs par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: des na po la dbang po gnyis bsrubs pas rol ni tshogs par bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, rolling means the union of the two organs. Gathering should be explained as rolling.

original: tam  ham ba au kha dzdza ae gha de mma aa n'a pa dzdza ai zhes pa la ti  ham zhes pa po la dang ka kko la yang dag par sbyar ba la bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: tam  ham ba au kha dzdza ae gha de mma aa n'a pa dzdza ai zhes pa la ti  ham zhes pa po la dang ka kko la yang dag par sbyar ba la bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Tam ham bāhu jja e ghade mam anāvajja i. Ti ham means one should eat the union of the two organs, the lotus and the kakkola.

original: ba la ni sha ste de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: ba la ni sha ste de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na phung po lnga'o //
translated: The five aggregates are the five Sugatas, since they are the nature of form and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi sha za bar bya zhing rang bzhin med par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sha za bar bya zhing rang bzhin med par bya ste /
translated: One should eat their flesh, that is, make them essenceless.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyi zhu bar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyi zhu bar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are melted down into the nature of the bodhicitta.

original: ma da na ni chang ste me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: ma da na ni chang ste me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Madana is liquor, that is, the bodhicitta endowed with the five intuitions such as the mirror intuition.

original: gha dem ne po la dang ka kko la sbyar bas yang dag bar bsdams nas ches cher btung ste btung bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gha dem ne po la dang ka kko la sbyar bas yang dag bar bsdams nas ches cher btung ste btung bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Having combined it with the ghaṭṭanī and kakkola, one should drink it, that is, drink it to the fullest extent.

original: ha le k'a li nydza ra pa ni aa ai dundu ra ta him bi dzdza aa ai /
analyzed: ha le k'a li nydza ra pa ni aa ai dundu ra ta him bi dzdza aa ai /
translated: Hāle kāliñjarapaṇai aidundurathaṃ vibhajja ai.

original: zhes pa la ha le ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la ha le ni bod pa'o //
translated: Here, hāle means “take.”

original: k'a li nydza ra ni skal pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems te padma'i ze 'brur rab tu 'jug pa'o zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: k'a li nydza ra ni skal pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems te padma'i ze 'brur rab tu 'jug pa'o zhes pa'i bar ro //
translated: Kāliñjara is the fortunate bodhicitta, which enters the lotus.

original: dun du ru ni skal pa mod pa mig la sogs pa'i skye mched de /
analyzed: dun du ru ni skal pa mod pa mig la sogs pa'i skye mched de /
translated: The word dūru means the eyes and so forth, the limited sense-spheres.

original: dor ba ni sel bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: dor ba ni sel bar byed pa ste /
translated: The word kṣipta means to be removed, to be eliminated.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i gnas la rnam par 'jog pa'o zhes pa'i don to //🔽tsa au sa ma ka sthu ri si hla ka bpu ra l'a ai aa ai /🔽zhes pa'i bzhi mnyam gyi sgra yis rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i gnas la rnam par 'jog pa'o zhes pa'i don to // tsa au sa ma ka sthu ri si hla ka bpu ra l'a ai aa ai / zhes pa'i bzhi mnyam gyi sgra yis rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The meaning is that one is established in the abode of essencelessness.🔽The word cāṣa means Vairocana.

original: gla rtsi'i sgra yis mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: gla rtsi'i sgra yis mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The word kastūrika means Akṣobhya.

original: si hla ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: si hla ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The word śa ila means Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: ga pur ni 'od dpag tu med par 'dod do ;🔽;'di rnams dang lhan cig bcom ldan 'das dbyer med pa'i yan lag gis bzhugs so //
analyzed: ga pur ni 'od dpag tu med par 'dod do ; ;'di rnams dang lhan cig bcom ldan 'das dbyer med pa'i yan lag gis bzhugs so //
translated: The word kapūra means Amitābha.

original: zhes pa'i don to //🔽m'a la ai ndha na sh'a li dza ta him bha ru kh'a ai aa ai /
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to // m'a la ai ndha na sh'a li dza ta him bha ru kh'a ai aa ai /
translated: The meaning is that the Bhagavān resides with these, inseparable.

original: zhes ba m'a la ai ndha na ni tshod ma ste phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: zhes ba m'a la ai ndha na ni tshod ma ste phung po lnga'o //
translated: The word māṣa means the five aggregates.

original: sh'a li dza ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes te rgyun ma chad par ma lus par bdag gi dbang du bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sh'a li dza ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes te rgyun ma chad par ma lus par bdag gi dbang du bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Śālī is the wisdom of the Tathāgatas, which is to be brought under one’s control without exception through uninterrupted practice.

original: phrem kha na khe ta ka ranta shuddha na mu ni aa ai /
analyzed: phrem kha na khe ta ka ranta shuddha na mu ni aa ai /
translated: Phreṃ khaṇakaraṃṭaśuddhanamunināiḥ.

original: zhes pa la phrem kha na ni 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la phrem kha na ni 'ong ba'o //
translated: Here, khaṇakaraṃṭa means coming and going.

original: 'gro ba ni kha  ta ste 'gro ba dang 'ong ba 'di dag 'gog pas dag pa dang ma dag pa'i shes pa rtogs par mi nus so zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni kha  ta ste 'gro ba dang 'ong ba 'di dag 'gog pas dag pa dang ma dag pa'i shes pa rtogs par mi nus so zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: Since these coming and going are stopped, pure and impure consciousness cannot be realized. This is the intended meaning.

original: ni ram shu aam ghe tsa d'a bi aa ai ta him dza @128a * //🔽sha r'a ba pa ni aa ai /
analyzed: ni ram shu aam ghe tsa d'a bi aa ai ta him dza @128a * // sha r'a ba pa ni aa ai /
translated: Nirmaśu aṃgheca dvāvihaiṃjaśarāvapaṇi.

original: zhes pa la rus pa'i rgyan ni ni ram shu ste 'dis ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la rus pa'i rgyan ni ni ram shu ste 'dis ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'o //
translated: Here, nirmaśu is a bone ornament, which is the bodhicitta vajra, which is the nature of the five wisdoms.

original: tsa d'a bi ni yid la mi byed pa la 'dog pa'o //
analyzed: tsa d'a bi ni yid la mi byed pa la 'dog pa'o //
translated: Ca dvā means nonattention.

original: sha r'a pa ni ni ro ste bdag med pa'i byang chub kyi sems padma'i sna'i rtse mo rnam par gnas pa'o zhes pa'i don to ;
analyzed: sha r'a pa ni ni ro ste bdag med pa'i byang chub kyi sems padma'i sna'i rtse mo rnam par gnas pa'o zhes pa'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is that the bodhicitta of selflessness is situated at the tip of the nose of the lotus.

original: ; ma la ya dza ku ntu ru ba tta ai di ndi ma ta him na ba dzdzi aa ai /
analyzed: ; ma la ya dza ku ntu ru ba tta ai di ndi ma ta him na ba dzdzi aa ai /
translated: Malaya-ja-kun-tu-ru-va-tta-idim-a-ta-him-a-va-jji-a-i.

original: zhes pa la ma la ya dza ni 'du bar 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes pa la ma la ya dza ni 'du bar 'dod do //
translated: Malaya-ja means “desiring to gather.”

original: bde ba dang lhan cig mig la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes rgyur byas nas byang chub sems rdo rje shes rab dang lhan cig 'du bar bshad do //
analyzed: bde ba dang lhan cig mig la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes rgyur byas nas byang chub sems rdo rje shes rab dang lhan cig 'du bar bshad do //
translated: The bodhicitta vajra together with wisdom is explained to gather all the tathāgatas, such as the eyes and so on, together with bliss as the cause of gnosis.

original: ku ntu ru ni dbang po gnyis yang dag par sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: ku ntu ru ni dbang po gnyis yang dag par sbyor ba ste /
translated: Kun-tu-ru means the union of the two organs.

original: gnyis po 'du bas rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis po 'du bas rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: The two gathering is the engagement.

original: rab tu 'jug pa ni reg pa yin la /
analyzed: rab tu 'jug pa ni reg pa yin la /
translated: Engagement is contact.

original: di ndi ma ni de la mi reg pa yin la /
analyzed: di ndi ma ni de la mi reg pa yin la /
translated: Dim-a-ta means not touching that.

original: thams cad gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa ngos pa'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa ngos pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term is that all are one.

original: drang ba'i don gyis ni go sla'o //
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyis ni go sla'o //
translated: The interpretable meaning is easy to understand.

original: dran pa mi 'phrogs rnal 'byor las //
analyzed: dran pa mi 'phrogs rnal 'byor las //
translated: The yoga of the unassailable mindfulness.

original: he ru ka yi gzugs kyis gar //🔽chags pa'i sems kyis sgom pa ste //
analyzed: he ru ka yi gzugs kyis gar // chags pa'i sems kyis sgom pa ste //
translated: The dance with the form of Heruka.🔽The meditation with the mind of passion.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par goms sems kyis //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par goms sems kyis //
translated: The mind of continuous familiarization.

original: zhes pa 'di'i nges pa'i don ni gsungs pa yang //
analyzed: zhes pa 'di'i nges pa'i don ni gsungs pa yang //
translated: The definitive meaning of this is also stated:

original: dga' bas shes rab mthong ba las //
analyzed: dga' bas shes rab mthong ba las //
translated: From the sight of wisdom through joy,

original: lta ba'i ngo bos skye bar byed //
analyzed: lta ba'i ngo bos skye bar byed //
translated: The view is generated by the essence.

original: dpal mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du yang gsungs pa //
analyzed: dpal mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du yang gsungs pa //
translated: It is also said in the Shri Herukagur:

original: chos 'byung grong khyer gang gi gnas //🔽rdo rje dam tshig glu len las //
analyzed: chos 'byung grong khyer gang gi gnas // rdo rje dam tshig glu len las //
translated: In the city of the phenomena source,🔽From the song of the vajra commitment,

original: rdo rje rkang pas gar stabs te //
analyzed: rdo rje rkang pas gar stabs te //
translated: With the dance of the vajra feet,

original: rdza rnga sgeg sogs khyad par du'o //
analyzed: rdza rnga sgeg sogs khyad par du'o //
translated: The special drum, beauty, and so forth.

original: zhes so // rgyud gzhan du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // rgyud gzhan du yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said in another tantra:

original: padma'i gdan gyi dbus su ni //
analyzed: padma'i gdan gyi dbus su ni //
translated: In the center of the lotus seat,

original: gang zhig sems ni yang dag gnas //
analyzed: gang zhig sems ni yang dag gnas //
translated: Where the mind is perfectly placed,

original: zhi ba de nyid yang dag dag / lhan cig skyes dga' gar mkhan no //
analyzed: zhi ba de nyid yang dag dag / lhan cig skyes dga' gar mkhan no //
translated: The dance of the innate joy of the pacified suchness

original: gar gyi chos ni de nyid shes //
analyzed: gar gyi chos ni de nyid shes //
translated: Knows the suchness of the dance.

original: gar byed pa ste the tshom med //
analyzed: gar byed pa ste the tshom med //
translated: The one who dances is without doubt.

original: 'jig rten rnams la phan pa'i rgyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams la phan pa'i rgyur //
translated: For the sake of benefiting the world,

original: 'jig rten chos kyi gar byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten chos kyi gar byed do //
translated: he performs the dance of worldly phenomena.

original: de nyid 'di ni sbas pa che //
analyzed: de nyid 'di ni sbas pa che //
translated: This very one is the great concealer,

original: phyag rgya chen po ster ba po //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ster ba po //
translated: the bestower of the great seal.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i gsung ji bzhin //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i gsung ji bzhin //
translated: Just as it is the speech of Vajrasattva,

original: 'bad pa yis ni bsrung bar bya //
analyzed: 'bad pa yis ni bsrung bar bya //
translated: it should be guarded with effort.

original: bde dang dga' dang mgu ba yis //
analyzed: bde dang dga' dang mgu ba yis //
translated: With bliss, joy, and delight,🔽through the display of song and music,

original: glu dang rol mo'i rnam 'phrul dang // dri dang phreng ba byug pa yis //
