original: glu rnams kyis rab tu sad par gyur pa ni phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs pa thams cad dang 'gro ba mtha' dag sgyu ma lta bur gzigs nas sems can gyi don gyi ched du slar yang skye bar mdzad do //
analyzed: glu rnams kyis rab tu sad par gyur pa ni phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs pa thams cad dang 'gro ba mtha' dag sgyu ma lta bur gzigs nas sems can gyi don gyi ched du slar yang skye bar mdzad do //
translated: is awakened by the songs. Having seen all the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so forth, as well as the entire world, as illusion-like, he again takes birth for the sake of sentient beings.

original: dpal shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi le'ur gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: dpal shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi le'ur gsungs pa yang /
translated: And it is said in the chapter on omniscience in the glorious Perfection of Wisdom:

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das de ma lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ma lags te /
translated: The Blessed One said, “No, Subhūti.

original: bcom ldan 'das sgyu ma de gzhan la gzugs de gzhan pa ma lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sgyu ma de gzhan la gzugs de gzhan pa ma lags te /
translated: The Blessed One said, ‘The illusion is not one thing and the form another.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzugs kho na sgyu ma'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzugs kho na sgyu ma'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, ‘Form itself is illusion.

original: sgyu ma kho na gzugs lags so //
analyzed: sgyu ma kho na gzugs lags so //
translated: Illusion itself is form.

original: bcom ldan 'das sgyu ma de gzhan la tshor ba de yang gzhan /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sgyu ma de gzhan la tshor ba de yang gzhan /
translated: The Blessed One said, ‘The illusion is not one thing and the feeling another,

original: 'du shes de yang gzhan /
analyzed: 'du shes de yang gzhan /
translated: the perception another,

original: 'du byed de rnams kyang gzhan ma lags kyi //
analyzed: 'du byed de rnams kyang gzhan ma lags kyi //
translated: the volitional factors another,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar sgyu ma kho na tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams so zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar sgyu ma kho na tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams so zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, ‘Thus, illusion itself is feeling, perception, and volitional factors.’

original: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su yang gsungs pa //
analyzed: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su yang gsungs pa //
translated: And in the Śrī-prathama-buddha, it is also said:

original: rdo rje can des glu rnams gsan nas srid pa gsum po mtha' dag mig 'phrul lta bur ni //
analyzed: rdo rje can des glu rnams gsan nas srid pa gsum po mtha' dag mig 'phrul lta bur ni //
translated: Having heard the songs, the vajra-holder saw the entire triple world as like a magical illusion,

original: gzigs nas bskyed pa mdzad de dri med 'od zer 'phro ba rang gi mtshan ma spro byas nas //
analyzed: gzigs nas bskyed pa mdzad de dri med 'od zer 'phro ba rang gi mtshan ma spro byas nas //
translated: and having emanated the creation, radiating stainless light rays, he emanated his own sign,

original: rdo rje'i rgyan ldan rgyal ba'i @133a * //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rgyan ldan rgyal ba'i @133a * //
translated: endowed with vajra ornaments, the victor’s

original: bdag po'i cod pan can ni shes rab ma yis 'khyud pa yang //
analyzed: bdag po'i cod pan can ni shes rab ma yis 'khyud pa yang //
translated: The lord, wearing a crown, is embraced by the wisdom consort.

original: shes rab thabs kyis rgyal po slar yang dkyil 'khor ma lus pa ni rab tu spro ba yang /
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyis rgyal po slar yang dkyil 'khor ma lus pa ni rab tu spro ba yang /
translated: The king, by means of wisdom and method, again radiates the entire mandala.

original: slar yang de nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang de nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: Again, it is said in that very [Hevajra Tantra]:

original: rtag dang mi rtag mthong ste de lta na yang blun po'i blo can sems ni dag don ched //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag mthong ste de lta na yang blun po'i blo can sems ni dag don ched //
translated: Seeing the permanent and impermanent, still, for the sake of the pure mind, the foolish one should practice.

original: sgrub thabs brjod par bya ste snying por gyur pa 'ga' yang 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba med //
analyzed: sgrub thabs brjod par bya ste snying por gyur pa 'ga' yang 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba med //
translated: There is nothing to be accomplished here, nothing at all that has become the essence.

original: gang zhig bsgrub bya sgrub pa po de 'khrul zhes rdo rje can gyi sgrub thabs mtha' dag gang //
analyzed: gang zhig bsgrub bya sgrub pa po de 'khrul zhes rdo rje can gyi sgrub thabs mtha' dag gang //
translated: The entire means of accomplishment of the vajra-holder is that which is to be accomplished and the one who accomplishes it are deluded.

original: de phyir rgyal po rang sems dri ma rnam par bral ba dkyil 'khor dbang por rab tu bya //
analyzed: de phyir rgyal po rang sems dri ma rnam par bral ba dkyil 'khor dbang por rab tu bya //
translated: Therefore, O king, make your own mind, free from stains, the lord of the mandala.

original: zhes so // aom h'um dag las rdo rje che //
analyzed: zhes so // aom h'um dag las rdo rje che //
translated: From the two, Oṃ and Hūṃ, arises the great vajra.

original: zhu ba'i gzugs las bzhengs pa ni //
analyzed: zhu ba'i gzugs las bzhengs pa ni //
translated: Arisen from the form of the melted [vajra],

original: kha dog nag po drag chen po //
analyzed: kha dog nag po drag chen po //
translated: black in color, very wrathful,

original: spyan gsum pa dbu skra dmar ser gyen du 'bar ba'i spyi bor sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa /
analyzed: spyan gsum pa dbu skra dmar ser gyen du 'bar ba'i spyi bor sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa /
translated: He has three eyes, and his orange hair bristles upward and is marked with a vajra cross on top.

original: dpral ba'i steng du mgo bo lnga'i phreng bas rnam par brgyan pa smin ma 'khyog po dang bcas pa'i khro gnyer can la zhal gtsigs pa /
analyzed: dpral ba'i steng du mgo bo lnga'i phreng bas rnam par brgyan pa smin ma 'khyog po dang bcas pa'i khro gnyer can la zhal gtsigs pa /
translated: He is adorned with a garland of five heads above his forehead, and he has scowling, contorted eyebrows and a gaping mouth.

original: zhal dang po nag po g-yas pa dkar ba /
analyzed: zhal dang po nag po g-yas pa dkar ba /
translated: His first face is black, the right face is white,🔽and the left face is red.

original: g-yon pa dmar ba slar yang g-yon gyi zhal gnyis nag pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa dmar ba slar yang g-yon gyi zhal gnyis nag pa /
translated: The two left faces are black,🔽and the two right faces are black.

original: de bzhin du g-yas kyi zhal gnyis nag po steng zhal du ba'i mdog can rnam par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yas kyi zhal gnyis nag po steng zhal du ba'i mdog can rnam par 'gyur ba /
translated: The upper face is the color of smoke and contorted.

original: zhal rnams thams cad mche ba gtsigs zhing spyan gsum pa can /🔽phyag g-yas pa brgyad rnams su padma'i snod brgyad du rim pa ji lta bar glang po che dang rta dang bong bu dang ba lang dang rnga mo dang / mi dang byi la ste /
analyzed: zhal rnams thams cad mche ba gtsigs zhing spyan gsum pa can / phyag g-yas pa brgyad rnams su padma'i snod brgyad du rim pa ji lta bar glang po che dang rta dang bong bu dang ba lang dang rnga mo dang / mi dang byi la ste /
translated: All the faces have bared fangs and three eyes.🔽In the eight right hands are eight lotus bowls, in which are, in order, an elephant, a horse, a donkey, an ox, a camel, a human, and a cat.

original: de bzhin du g-yon gyi thod pa brgyad rnams su /
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon gyi thod pa brgyad rnams su /
translated: In the eight skull cups in the left hands are,

original: sa'i lha dang chu dang rlung dang me'i lha dang / zla ba dang nyi ma dang / gshin rje dang / nor sbyin can phyag rgya drug dang ldan pa mgo bo rlon pa'i phreng bas sku la brgyan pa /
analyzed: sa'i lha dang chu dang rlung dang me'i lha dang / zla ba dang nyi ma dang / gshin rje dang / nor sbyin can phyag rgya drug dang ldan pa mgo bo rlon pa'i phreng bas sku la brgyan pa /
translated: The deities of earth, water, wind, fire, moon, sun, Yama, and Kubera, all with six symbolic ornaments, their bodies adorned with garlands of fresh heads,

original: gcer bu g-yas brkyang ba'i stabs kyi zhabs kyis bzhugs pa phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu'i bdud pa ni mnan pa /
analyzed: gcer bu g-yas brkyang ba'i stabs kyi zhabs kyis bzhugs pa phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu'i bdud pa ni mnan pa /
translated: naked, standing in the pose of right leg extended, trampling on the demons of the aggregates, afflictions, Lord of Death, and the son of gods.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gar stabs kyi tshul gyis bzhugs par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gar stabs kyi tshul gyis bzhugs par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Imagine that they stand in the manner of dancing on the discs of the sun.

original: bdag med ma nag mo phyag gnyis ma //
analyzed: bdag med ma nag mo phyag gnyis ma //
translated: Vajrayoginī is black, with two arms,

original: gri gug dang thod pa dang bcas pa'i g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi phyag dag gis bcom ldan 'das la snyoms par zhugs pa gcer bu phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gri gug dang thod pa dang bcas pa'i g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi phyag dag gis bcom ldan 'das la snyoms par zhugs pa gcer bu phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa /
translated: her right and left hands holding a flaying knife and skull cup, embracing the Bhagavān, naked, with the five symbolic ornaments,

original: spyan gsum pa dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa //
analyzed: spyan gsum pa dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa //
translated: with three eyes, tawny hair swirling upward,

original: mgo bo'i phreng bas mgo bor rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: mgo bo'i phreng bas mgo bor rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: her head adorned with a garland of heads.

original: mi mgo skam po'i phreng bas sku @133b la brgyan pa /
analyzed: mi mgo skam po'i phreng bas sku @133b la brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with a garland of dry human heads.🔽With his right leg extended in the manner of dancing on the moon, he is in union with Bhagavatī, who is supremely blissful.

original: g-yas brkyang ba'i zla ba'i zhabs stabs kyis mchog tu bde ba chen pos bcom ldan 'das la snyoms par zhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang ba'i zla ba'i zhabs stabs kyis mchog tu bde ba chen pos bcom ldan 'das la snyoms par zhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize Bhagavatī.

original: de la shar gyi sgor gam yig las byung ba'i goo r'i kha dog nag mo phyag g-yas bar gri gug dang / g-yon par nya ro hi ta can tshangs pa mnan pa /
analyzed: de la shar gyi sgor gam yig las byung ba'i goo r'i kha dog nag mo phyag g-yas bar gri gug dang / g-yon par nya ro hi ta can tshangs pa mnan pa /
translated: At the eastern gate, from gaṃ, is Gaurī, black in color, holding a flaying knife in her right hand and a rohita fish in her left hand, standing on Brahmā.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin spro bar bya'o //
translated: One should imagine her emanating as the nature of the aggregate of form.

original: lho'i sgor tsam yig las skyes pa'i chom rkun ma btsod kyi kha dog can phyag g-yas pa na cang te'u dang g-yon pa phag pa can dbang po la chibs pa tshor ba'i phung po'i rang bzhin spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: lho'i sgor tsam yig las skyes pa'i chom rkun ma btsod kyi kha dog can phyag g-yas pa na cang te'u dang g-yon pa phag pa can dbang po la chibs pa tshor ba'i phung po'i rang bzhin spro bar bya'o //
translated: At the southern gate, from caṃ, is Caurī, the color of vermilion, holding a ḍamaru in her right hand and a pig in her left hand, riding Indra. One should imagine her emanating as the nature of the aggregate of feeling.

original: nub kyi sgor bam yig las skyes pa'i ro langs ma gser btso ma lta bu phyag g-yas pa na rus sbal dang / g-yon pa na chu skyes kyi snod can nye dbang mnan pa /
analyzed: nub kyi sgor bam yig las skyes pa'i ro langs ma gser btso ma lta bu phyag g-yas pa na rus sbal dang / g-yon pa na chu skyes kyi snod can nye dbang mnan pa /
translated: At the western gate, one should visualize the zombie woman born from the syllable vaṃ, the color of refined gold, with a tortoise in her right hand and a lotus vessel in her left hand, trampling on Yama.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po'i rang bzhin bsam par bya'o //🔽byang gi sgor gham yig las skyes pa'i za nus ma mar ka ta'i mdog can phyag g-yas pa na sbrul dang / g-yon pa na thod pa can drag po la chibs pa 'du byed kyi phung po'i rang bzhin blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po'i rang bzhin bsam par bya'o // byang gi sgor gham yig las skyes pa'i za nus ma mar ka ta'i mdog can phyag g-yas pa na sbrul dang / g-yon pa na thod pa can drag po la chibs pa 'du byed kyi phung po'i rang bzhin blta bar bya'o //
translated: She is the nature of the aggregate of perception.🔽At the northern gate, one should visualize the able-to-eat woman born from the syllable ghaṃ, the color of emerald, with a snake in her right hand and a skull in her left hand, riding Rudra, the nature of the aggregate of formation.

original: dbang ldan gyi mtshams su pukka s'i bam yig las skyes pa sngon mo phyag g-yas pa na seng ge dang / g-yon pa na dgra sta can gshin rje mnan pa sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi mtshams su pukka s'i bam yig las skyes pa sngon mo phyag g-yas pa na seng ge dang / g-yon pa na dgra sta can gshin rje mnan pa sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: In the northeast, one should visualize Pukkasi born from the syllable vaṃ, blue, with a lion in her right hand and an axe in her left hand, trampling on Yama, the nature of the earth element.

original: me'i mtshams su sham yig las skyes pa'i ri khrod ma dkar mo g-yas pa na dge slong dang / g-yon pa na khar gsil can nor gyi 'dren pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: me'i mtshams su sham yig las skyes pa'i ri khrod ma dkar mo g-yas pa na dge slong dang / g-yon pa na khar gsil can nor gyi 'dren pa la gnas pa /
translated: At the southeast corner, white Śāntī born from the letter śaṃ holds a bhikṣu with the right hand and a water-pot with the left hand, standing on a yakṣa.

original: chu'i khams kyi rang bzhin dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams kyi rang bzhin dgod par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize her as the nature of the water element.

original: bden bral gyi mtshams su gtum mo nam mkha'i mdog can //
analyzed: bden bral gyi mtshams su gtum mo nam mkha'i mdog can //
translated: At the southwest corner, Caṇḍālī the color of space,

original: tsam yig las skyes pa g-yas pa na 'khor lo 'dzin pa //
analyzed: tsam yig las skyes pa g-yas pa na 'khor lo 'dzin pa //
translated: born from the letter caṃ, holding a wheel with the right hand,

original: phyag g-yon pa na thod gshol can srid po mnan pa me'i khams kyi rang bzhin can bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa na thod gshol can srid po mnan pa me'i khams kyi rang bzhin can bsgom par bya'o //
translated: and a plow with the left hand, should be visualized as the nature of the fire element, trampling on Kubera.

original: rlung gi phyogs su dam yig las skyes pa'i g-yung mo khra bo'i mdog can phyag g-yas pa na rdo rje dang g-yon pa sdigs mdzub can /
analyzed: rlung gi phyogs su dam yig las skyes pa'i g-yung mo khra bo'i mdog can phyag g-yas pa na rdo rje dang g-yon pa sdigs mdzub can /
translated: At the northwest corner, one should visualize Pukkāsī born from the letter taṃ, striped, holding a vajra with the right hand and a threatening gesture with the left hand,

original: thags bzangs ris la gnas pa rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin can bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: thags bzangs ris la gnas pa rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin can bsgom par bya'o //
translated: trampling on Vemacitrin, the nature of the wind element.

original: 'di rnams thams cad spyan gsum pa zhal mche ba gtsigs pa can dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa /
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad spyan gsum pa zhal mche ba gtsigs pa can dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa /
translated: All of them have three eyes, bared fangs, and orange hair bristling upward.

original: gcer bu phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gcer bu phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa /
translated: They are naked, and have the five symbolic ornaments.

original: skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis bzhugs pa //
analyzed: skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis bzhugs pa //
translated: They stand in the ardhaparyaṅka dancing posture.

original: byang chub kyi spros pa las yang dag par byung ba bsgom par bya'o //🔽zhes pa la @134a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi spros pa las yang dag par byung ba bsgom par bya'o // zhes pa la @134a * //
translated: They should be visualized as arising from the incense of enlightenment.

original: sogs pa drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: sogs pa drang ba'i don to //
translated: This and more is the interpretable meaning.

original: da ni nges pa'i don gsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: da ni nges pa'i don gsal bar bya ste /
translated: Now the definitive meaning will be clarified.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is said:

original: 'di ltar lhan cig skyes pa gcig pu de kho na chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa ste rnam pa bzhi'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig skyes pa gcig pu de kho na chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa ste rnam pa bzhi'o zhes so //
translated: Thus, that very connate [mind] is the four: suchness, the enjoyment body, and the emanation.

original: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su gsungs pa yang /
translated: And it is said in the glorious First Buddha:

original: shes rab ma yin thabs kyang min 'di lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ste chos kyi skur gyur pa //
analyzed: shes rab ma yin thabs kyang min 'di lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ste chos kyi skur gyur pa //
translated: This is not wisdom, nor is it method, but the connate body, the dharmakāya.

original: shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin nges par mun pa dang bral ye shes rnam shes dbye ba las /
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin nges par mun pa dang bral ye shes rnam shes dbye ba las /
translated: The nature of wisdom and method, definitely free from darkness, is the division of wisdom and consciousness.

original: 'di ni longs spyod rdzogs sku sgra brnyan lta bu sems can du ma'i don ni byed pa po //
analyzed: 'di ni longs spyod rdzogs sku sgra brnyan lta bu sems can du ma'i don ni byed pa po //
translated: This is the Enjoyment Body, like an echo, the agent that acts for the sake of many sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams smin ched du slar yang 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku ru 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can rnams smin ched du slar yang 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku ru 'gyur //
translated: Again, this becomes the Emanation Body of the Buddhas in order to ripen sentient beings.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' gcig 'di dus mtha'i sprin dang mtshungs pa he ru kar ni byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' gcig 'di dus mtha'i sprin dang mtshungs pa he ru kar ni byung bar 'gyur //
translated: This single Vajrasattva arises as Heruka, like the cloud at the end of time,

original: gdug pa rnams smin don te de yang dam tshig rgyal ba rmongs pa rnams ni bde ba'i don //
analyzed: gdug pa rnams smin don te de yang dam tshig rgyal ba rmongs pa rnams ni bde ba'i don //
translated: for the sake of ripening the wicked, and also as Samayasattva for the sake of the bliss of the deluded.

original: rin chen dbang po sdug bsngal ldan pa'i de yang pad 'dzin chags can rnams kyi chags pa'i slad //
analyzed: rin chen dbang po sdug bsngal ldan pa'i de yang pad 'dzin chags can rnams kyi chags pa'i slad //
translated: Ratnasaṃbhava is for the sake of the suffering, and also Padma Holder arises for the sake of the passion of the passionate.

original: bgegs rnams gzhom pa'i don du phyag gi padmar ral gri don yod grub pa 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bgegs rnams gzhom pa'i don du phyag gi padmar ral gri don yod grub pa 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Amoghasiddhi arises in the lotus hand of the sword for the sake of destroying obstacles.

original: sems can rnams ni smin pa'i slad du sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba rnams kyis dus kun du //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni smin pa'i slad du sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba rnams kyis dus kun du //
translated: For the sake of ripening sentient beings, he always appears in all times with the divisions of body, speech, and mind.

original: des pa'i rdo rje can gyi bzhugs pa rnam gsum phyi dang nang dang gzhan du'ang rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: des pa'i rdo rje can gyi bzhugs pa rnam gsum phyi dang nang dang gzhan du'ang rab tu 'gyur //
translated: The three states of the gentle Vajra are also external, internal, and alternative.

original: phyi rol sna tshogs phyogs su 'gyur te mchog gi lus la srog gi rlung ni rab tu rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol sna tshogs phyogs su 'gyur te mchog gi lus la srog gi rlung ni rab tu rgyu ba'o //
translated: The external is the various directions, and the supreme body is the movement of the life-force wind.

original: khyab bdag gi gang sa sogs dkyil 'khor la rab gyur te rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga la //
analyzed: khyab bdag gi gang sa sogs dkyil 'khor la rab gyur te rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga la //
translated: The pervasive lord is the mandala of earth, and so forth, in the bhaga of the Vajra Queen.

original: gcig pu rdo rje can ni dbye ba gsum ste yul dang yul can khams rnams kyis kyang bskor //
analyzed: gcig pu rdo rje can ni dbye ba gsum ste yul dang yul can khams rnams kyis kyang bskor //
translated: The single Vajra is threefold, surrounded by the realms of objects, subjects, and elements.

original: dus gsum gnas gsum du bzhugs srid pa gsum du gnas pa'ang sems can du ma'i don slad du'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gnas gsum du bzhugs srid pa gsum du gnas pa'ang sems can du ma'i don slad du'o //
translated: Abiding in the three times and three places, abiding in the three existences, for the sake of many sentient beings.

original: de ltar nges pa sku yi rdo rje mchog gi yon tan rnam mang dkyil 'khor rnam par gsungs //
analyzed: de ltar nges pa sku yi rdo rje mchog gi yon tan rnam mang dkyil 'khor rnam par gsungs //
translated: Thus, the mandala of the many qualities of the supreme body vajra is taught.

original: gsung gi rdo rje 'ang aa sogs ka sogs lha yi rnam pa nyid de mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs rnams kyi //
analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje 'ang aa sogs ka sogs lha yi rnam pa nyid de mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs rnams kyi //
translated: The speech vajra is also the forms of the deities such as A and Ka, the entire lineage of the victors.

original: stong pa drug gis thugs kyi rdo rje rnams gsum srid pa la gnas gtso bo'i rnam pa gcig / de bzhin ye shes rdo rje srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa sna tshogs yul gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: stong pa drug gis thugs kyi rdo rje rnams gsum srid pa la gnas gtso bo'i rnam pa gcig / de bzhin ye shes rdo rje srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa sna tshogs yul gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The three vajras of mind are the principal form abiding in the three existences, with the six emptinesses.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽h'um gi ye shes rjes su bsam par bya zhing /🔽dam tshig gi 'khor lo @134b la ye shes kyi 'khor lo cher 'bar ba myur du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o // h'um gi ye shes rjes su bsam par bya zhing / dam tshig gi 'khor lo @134b la ye shes kyi 'khor lo cher 'bar ba myur du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the wisdom vajra is the nature of the various objects that conquer the fear of existence.

original: zhes pa 'di'i don ni dpal dri ma med pa'i 'od du gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: zhes pa 'di'i don ni dpal dri ma med pa'i 'od du gsungs pa yang /
translated: The meaning of this is also stated in the glorious Vimalaprabhā:

original: 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa la /
analyzed: 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa la /
translated: Here, in the meditation on the maṇḍala wheel,

original: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: having completed the pledge maṇḍala,

original: de nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang 'ching ba dang mnyes pa dang / ro mnyam par byed pa zhes pa la lang tsho can ma dang rab tu 'grogs pa la ye shes sems dpa' ni khu ba ste dgongs pa'i skad gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: de nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang 'ching ba dang mnyes pa dang / ro mnyam par byed pa zhes pa la lang tsho can ma dang rab tu 'grogs pa la ye shes sems dpa' ni khu ba ste dgongs pa'i skad gzhan gyis so //
translated: The wisdom being is the semen in the union with the youthful maiden, by the other language of the intention.

original: de dgug pa ni srog la sogs pa'i rlung gi tshogs kyis byed de //
analyzed: de dgug pa ni srog la sogs pa'i rlung gi tshogs kyis byed de //
translated: The invocation of that is done by the group of the life-force and so forth winds.

original: steng du spyi bor byang chub kyi sems yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: steng du spyi bor byang chub kyi sems yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is made complete in the head above.

original: de zhu bar byas nas khu ba thig le'i gzugs mgrin pa dang snying ga dang lte ba dang / gsang ba'i padma la rab tu 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: de zhu bar byas nas khu ba thig le'i gzugs mgrin pa dang snying ga dang lte ba dang / gsang ba'i padma la rab tu 'jug par byed do //
translated: Having melted that, the semen in the form of a drop enters the throat, heart, navel, and secret lotus.

original: sa'i khams ni thig le'i gzugs de'i bcing ba byed do //
analyzed: sa'i khams ni thig le'i gzugs de'i bcing ba byed do //
translated: The earth element binds that drop form.

original: zhes pa mchog gi bde ba'i dbang gis shin tu mgyogs pas 'ongs pa 'gror mi ster ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa mchog gi bde ba'i dbang gis shin tu mgyogs pas 'ongs pa 'gror mi ster ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is not allowed to go by the power of supreme bliss, very quickly.

original: chu'i khams kyi thig le zhu ba dang gsang ba'i padma dang rdo rje nor bur gnas pa ni g-yo ba zhes brjod cing /
analyzed: chu'i khams kyi thig le zhu ba dang gsang ba'i padma dang rdo rje nor bur gnas pa ni g-yo ba zhes brjod cing /
translated: The melting of the water element's bindu, which is located in the secret lotus and the vajra jewel, is called “moving.”

original: mi 'pho ba'i bde ba'i dbang gis brnyes pa ste lus la bsil ba nyid du byed do //
analyzed: mi 'pho ba'i bde ba'i dbang gis brnyes pa ste lus la bsil ba nyid du byed do //
translated: It is attained by the power of unchanging bliss, and it cools the body.

original: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also stated in the Shri Paramādya:

original: shes rab chos 'byung la gnas mtha' dag slar yang spro ba byas te nges par thig le yis //
analyzed: shes rab chos 'byung la gnas mtha' dag slar yang spro ba byas te nges par thig le yis //
translated: The bindu, which is located in the wisdom-source, radiates out again in its entirety.

original: sna tshogs rgyan dang ldan zhing me long la gnas lta bu'i ye shes 'khor lo rang byung ba //
analyzed: sna tshogs rgyan dang ldan zhing me long la gnas lta bu'i ye shes 'khor lo rang byung ba //
translated: The self-arisen wheel of wisdom, which is endowed with various ornaments, is like a reflection in a mirror.

original: 'dod pa dang ni gzugs dang gzugs med srid pa rnam pa gsum po'ang rim pas sbyang byas te //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ni gzugs dang gzugs med srid pa rnam pa gsum po'ang rim pas sbyang byas te //
translated: The three types of existence—desire, form, and formless—are purified in stages.

original: phyi nas ye shes me lces srid pa gsum po mtha' dag dus gcig tu ni dgug par bya //
analyzed: phyi nas ye shes me lces srid pa gsum po mtha' dag dus gcig tu ni dgug par bya //
translated: Then, with the flame of wisdom, all three realms are summoned at once.

original: zhes pa des pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa des pa'i don to //
translated: This is the definitive meaning.

original: drang ba'i don gyis ni go sla'o //
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyis ni go sla'o //
translated: The provisional meaning is easy to understand.

original: sku gsung de bzhin thugs la ni //
analyzed: sku gsung de bzhin thugs la ni //
translated: The body, speech, and mind of the buddhas

original: aom a'a: h'um zhes gsang sngags las /🔽mkha' la spyod dang sa spyod nyid //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um zhes gsang sngags las / mkha' la spyod dang sa spyod nyid //
translated: From the mantra OṂ ĀḤ HŪṂ,🔽one should imagine the sky-goers, the earth-goers,

original: sa 'og gnas par bsam par bya //
analyzed: sa 'og gnas par bsam par bya //
translated: and the nether-world dwellers.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje yi //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje yi //
translated: The yoginīs of the vajra body, speech, and mind

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams rigs gsum byung //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams rigs gsum byung //
translated: arise as the three families.

original: 'di'i nges pa'i don ni de bzhin du yang rgyud gzhan du gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di'i nges pa'i don ni de bzhin du yang rgyud gzhan du gsungs te /
translated: The definitive meaning of this is stated in another tantra:

original: mkha' la ste padma mkha' 'gro'i dbus su mkha' spyod ma 'khor lo sa dga' ba'i ngang tshul 'di ste der gnas pa'i legs par spyod pa ni mkha' spyod ma'i 'khor lor yang dag par bshad de /
analyzed: mkha' la ste padma mkha' 'gro'i dbus su mkha' spyod ma 'khor lo sa dga' ba'i ngang tshul 'di ste der gnas pa'i legs par spyod pa ni mkha' spyod ma'i 'khor lor yang dag par bshad de /
translated: “In the sky, in the middle of the sky-wanderer lotus, the sky-goer is the nature of the stage of joy, and the conduct there is explained as the wheel of the sky-goer.

original: sa zhes pa sa'i dbus gnas pa @135a * //
analyzed: sa zhes pa sa'i dbus gnas pa @135a * //
translated: The earth is in the middle of the earth,

original: skye ba dang 'chi ba lte ba'i padma rnams la ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'chi ba lte ba'i padma rnams la ste /
translated: in the navel lotus of birth and death.

original: der gnas pa'i legs par rnam par spyod pa ni sa spyod ma'i 'khor lo yang dag par bshad do //
analyzed: der gnas pa'i legs par rnam par spyod pa ni sa spyod ma'i 'khor lo yang dag par bshad do //
translated: The conduct there is explained as the wheel of the earth-goer.”

original: sa 'og ces pa gang gsungs pa padmar byang chub kyi sems ltung bar byed cing t'am lam ste yid kyis phyi rol du nus pa ni sa 'og tu gnas pa zhes mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: sa 'og ces pa gang gsungs pa padmar byang chub kyi sems ltung bar byed cing t'am lam ste yid kyis phyi rol du nus pa ni sa 'og tu gnas pa zhes mtshan ma'o //
translated: The “underworld” is the falling of the bodhicitta in the lotus, and the “path” or mind is the ability to go outside, which is the sign of the “underworld.”

original: mig tu gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa'i rigs drug rnams dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: mig tu gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa'i rigs drug rnams dgod par bya'o //
translated: One should place the six families, beginning with Mohavajra, in the eyes.

original: gsungs pa yang rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par nyed pa dang mtshan nyid dang bral ba rnams kyis dbang bskur ba dang / de bzhin du mchod pa dang / bstod pa dang / bdud rtsi myang ba rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas bya'o zhes so //🔽rang gi lag pa g-yas g-yon gyi //
analyzed: gsungs pa yang rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par nyed pa dang mtshan nyid dang bral ba rnams kyis dbang bskur ba dang / de bzhin du mchod pa dang / bstod pa dang / bdud rtsi myang ba rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas bya'o zhes so // rang gi lag pa g-yas g-yon gyi //
translated: It is said that the consecration, and likewise the worship, praise, and tasting of the elixir, should be done by the yogī endowed with yoga, with various forms, with the enjoyment of the ripening of karma, and with the characteristics of the absence of decay.🔽With the thumb and little finger

original: mthe bo ming med dag gis ni //
analyzed: mthe bo ming med dag gis ni //
translated: of the right and left hands,🔽the yogī should squeeze

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rlabs gnyis su //🔽rnal 'byor ba yis btsir bar bya //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rlabs gnyis su // rnal 'byor ba yis btsir bar bya //
translated: the two waves of the enjoyment body.

original: phyi nas ye shes skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi nas ye shes skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Afterwards, wisdom will arise,

original: gzhon nu ma yid dga' ba bzhin //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma yid dga' ba bzhin //
translated: like the delight of a young woman.

original: de la ci yang skye 'gyur te //
analyzed: de la ci yang skye 'gyur te //
translated: Then anything arises,

original: lkugs pa'i rmi lam ji lta ba'o //
analyzed: lkugs pa'i rmi lam ji lta ba'o //
translated: like the dream of a mute.

original: zhes pa la 'dis rgyas par bshad pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la 'dis rgyas par bshad pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, the extensive explanation is stated.

original: rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa yang /
translated: Also, it is stated in the Tantra of Another:

original: g-yas dang g-yon zhes pa ni g-yas pa dang cig shos te 'di dag tha snyad ni gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa'i sems rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyis na aa ba dh'u t'i ni lag pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon zhes pa ni g-yas pa dang cig shos te 'di dag tha snyad ni gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa'i sems rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyis na aa ba dh'u t'i ni lag pa'o //
translated: “Right and left” are the right and the other. These are the same in convention. The mind is of the nature of the vajra. The avadhūtī is the hand.

original: de'i rgan po dang ming med dag ste brkyang ma dang ro ma de dag gis shes rab dang thabs 'jug bzhin pa'i rnal 'byor ma dag gis kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rlabs gnyis la btsir bar bya'o zhes pa la btsir ba ni kha sbyor ba dang 'khyud
analyzed: de'i rgan po dang ming med dag ste brkyang ma dang ro ma de dag gis shes rab dang thabs 'jug bzhin pa'i rnal 'byor ma dag gis kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rlabs gnyis la btsir bar bya'o zhes pa la btsir ba ni kha sbyor ba dang 'khyud
translated: Its right and left are the rasanā and lalanā. Those are the wisdom and means. The yoginīs enter. The two waves of the conventional and the ultimate are squeezed.

original: pa la sogs pa rnal 'byor pa'i longs spyod pa ro mnyam par byed pa ste /
analyzed: pa la sogs pa rnal 'byor pa'i longs spyod pa ro mnyam par byed pa ste /
translated: “Squeezed” is the union, the embrace, and so on. The yogin’s enjoyment is the equalization of taste.

original: longs spyod par gyur pa na rlabs gnyis longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod par gyur pa na rlabs gnyis longs spyod pa'o //
translated: When there is enjoyment, the two waves enjoy.

original: gzhon nu ma'i dga' ba zhes pa dus gnyis spangs pa chags pa dang bral ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma'i dga' ba zhes pa dus gnyis spangs pa chags pa dang bral ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The “pleasure of the young woman” is the abandonment of the two times, which means being free from attachment.

original: lkugs pa'i rmi lam zhes pa bdag nyid kyis rang nyid kyi shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lkugs pa'i rmi lam zhes pa bdag nyid kyis rang nyid kyi shes par bya'o //
translated: The “dream of the mute” is to be understood by oneself.

original: zhes pa ni brjod par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni brjod par mi nus pa ste /
translated: This is said to be “inexpressible,”

original: ngag gi lam las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag gi lam las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is beyond the path of speech.

original: 'di nyid du gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: 'di nyid du gsungs pa yang /
translated: This is also stated in the very same text:

original: lha de'i skad cig ci ltar lags //
analyzed: lha de'i skad cig ci ltar lags //
translated: “What is the moment of that deity?

original: gtso bo chen po bshad du gsol //
analyzed: gtso bo chen po bshad du gsol //
translated: Please explain, O Great Lord.”

original: de la thog ma dbus mtha' med //
analyzed: de la thog ma dbus mtha' med //
translated: “It has no beginning, middle, or end,

original: srid med mya ngan 'das pa med //
analyzed: srid med mya ngan 'das pa med //
translated: no existence and no transcendence of it.

original: 'di ni mchog tu bde chen nyid //
analyzed: 'di ni mchog tu bde chen nyid //
translated: This is the supreme great bliss,

original: bdag med gzhan yang med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med gzhan yang med pa'o //
translated: without self and without other.”

original: zhes so // dpal kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud la rdo rje'i tshig @135b gi snying po bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel du brtag pa gnyis par he ru ka mngon par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ste le'u lnga pa'o /
analyzed: zhes so // dpal kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud la rdo rje'i tshig @135b gi snying po bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel du brtag pa gnyis par he ru ka mngon par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ste le'u lnga pa'o /
translated: In the commentary on the condensed essence of the vajra words of the Shri Hevajra Tantra, this is the chapter on the second examination, called “The Manifestation of Heruka,” the fifth chapter.

original: // / da ni phyag rgya lnga'i rnam par dag pa rab tu rgyas pa 'chad cing bris sku bsgrub pa'i le'u gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / da ni phyag rgya lnga'i rnam par dag pa rab tu rgyas pa 'chad cing bris sku bsgrub pa'i le'u gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the chapter on the accomplishment of the painted image is stated, which explains the purification of the five symbolic ornaments in detail.

original: lha mo la ni dam 'khyud cing //
analyzed: lha mo la ni dam 'khyud cing //
translated: Embracing the goddess,

original: po la thod par bcug nas ni //
analyzed: po la thod par bcug nas ni //
translated: placing the skull in the lap,

original: zhes pa la bo la ni rdo rje'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la bo la ni rdo rje'o //
translated: In this, the lap is the vajra.

original: kam bde ba skyod par byed do zhes pas thod pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: kam bde ba skyod par byed do zhes pas thod pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since it causes the bliss of the ka to move, it should be called the skull.

original: dpal sam pu ta ru yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal sam pu ta ru yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said in the Śrī Saṃpuṭa:

original: chos kyis dbyings kyi lus can rnams //
analyzed: chos kyis dbyings kyi lus can rnams //
translated: Those who have the body of the realm of phenomena,

original: thod pa la ni su zhig smod //
analyzed: thod pa la ni su zhig smod //
translated: who would disparage the skull?

original: yang dag sbyor ba'i bde bsgrubs nas //
analyzed: yang dag sbyor ba'i bde bsgrubs nas //
translated: Having accomplished the bliss of union,

original: phyag rgya lnga ni rab gsal mdzad //
analyzed: phyag rgya lnga ni rab gsal mdzad //
translated: they make manifest the five symbolic ornaments.

original: dpal mtshan yang dag par brjod par gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: dpal mtshan yang dag par brjod par gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said in the Śrī-nāma-saṅgīti:

original: bsam pa'i khyad par ji bzhin du //
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par ji bzhin du //
translated: In accordance with the distinctions of thought,

original: sems can rnams la rab gsal mdzod //
analyzed: sems can rnams la rab gsal mdzod //
translated: they make manifest to sentient beings.🔽In order to remove all afflictions

original: nyon mongs ma lus bsal ba dang // mi shes ma lus gzhom slad du'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs ma lus bsal ba dang // mi shes ma lus gzhom slad du'o //
translated: and destroy all ignorance.

original: zhes so // bla ma slob dpon 'dod lha la //
analyzed: zhes so // bla ma slob dpon 'dod lha la //
translated: To the guru, the master, the god of desire,

original: phyag 'tshal don du 'khor lo 'dzin //🔽bla ma rdo rje 'dzin pa la //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal don du 'khor lo 'dzin // bla ma rdo rje 'dzin pa la //
translated: For the sake of saluting, one should hold a wheel.

original: smod tshig mi nyan pa yi ched //
analyzed: smod tshig mi nyan pa yi ched //
translated: For the sake of not listening to disparaging words to the guru vajra-holder,

original: rna ba dag la rna cha 'dzin //
analyzed: rna ba dag la rna cha 'dzin //
translated: one should wear earrings in the ears.

original: sngags kyi bzlas pa mgul rgyan nyid //
analyzed: sngags kyi bzlas pa mgul rgyan nyid //
translated: The mantra recitation is the necklace.

original: gdu bu srog chags gsod pa spang //
analyzed: gdu bu srog chags gsod pa spang //
translated: The bracelet is for the sake of abandoning killing.

original: phyag rgya bsten pa ska rags so //
analyzed: phyag rgya bsten pa ska rags so //
translated: The seal-practice is the belt.

original: zhes pa drang pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa drang pa'i don to //
translated: This is the interpretable meaning.

original: da ni nges pa'i don gsal par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni nges pa'i don gsal par bya ste /
translated: Now the definitive meaning will be clarified.

original: bla ma slob dpon 'dod lha zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le'o //
analyzed: bla ma slob dpon 'dod lha zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le'o //
translated: The guru, master, and desire god are the bindu of bodhicitta.

original: de'i 'dud pa ni 'pho ba ste de'i don du 'khor lo can 'dzin pa ste 'khor lo can ni 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'dud pa ni 'pho ba ste de'i don du 'khor lo can 'dzin pa ste 'khor lo can ni 'ching ba'o //
translated: Bowing to that is transference. For that purpose, one should hold a wheel, that is, one should bind a wheel.

original: zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: smod tshig ces pa la smod tshig ni nyams pa'o //
analyzed: smod tshig ces pa la smod tshig ni nyams pa'o //
translated: As for disparaging words, disparaging words are degeneration.

original: de mi nyan pa'i ched du rna ba dag la rna cha gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de mi nyan pa'i ched du rna ba dag la rna cha gzung bar bya ste /
translated: For the sake of not listening to that, one should wear earrings in the ears.

original: rna cha zhes pa ni rna cha 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: rna cha zhes pa ni rna cha 'ching ba'o //
translated: Earrings means binding earrings.

original: yid skyob par byed do zhes pas na sngags te bzlas pa zhes pa 'gog pa'i ched du /
analyzed: yid skyob par byed do zhes pas na sngags te bzlas pa zhes pa 'gog pa'i ched du /
translated: Since it protects the mind, it is a mantra, which is to say, a repetition.

original: mgul rgyan zhes pa mgul rgyan 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: mgul rgyan zhes pa mgul rgyan 'ching ba'o //
translated: The necklace is the binding of the necklace.

original: gdu bu srog chags gsod pa spang //
analyzed: gdu bu srog chags gsod pa spang //
translated: The bracelet is the abandonment of the killing of living beings.

original: zhes pa srog ni gang gi phyir sems su 'dod de /
analyzed: zhes pa srog ni gang gi phyir sems su 'dod de /
translated: The life is what is considered to be the mind.

original: de gsod par mi bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de gsod par mi bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of one should not kill it.

original: phyag rgya ni las kyi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya ni las kyi phyag rgya ste /
translated: The seal is the karmamudra.

original: bsten pa zhes pa bsten par bya ba'i ched du ska rags zhes pa ska rags 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: bsten pa zhes pa bsten par bya ba'i ched du ska rags zhes pa ska rags 'ching ba'o //
translated: The belt is the binding of the belt.

original: de ltar phyag rgya lnga'i man ngag bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas nges pa'i don gyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyag rgya lnga'i man ngag bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas nges pa'i don gyis shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the five seals should be known by means of the definitive meaning in the sequence of the lineage of gurus, which is the oral instruction.

translated: One should give to the chief of the assembly.🔽To the yoginis of the east, south, west, and north, one should give the hides of the horse, dog, human, elephant, and bull.

original: dbang ldan gyi rnal 'byor ma dang bden bral phyogs kyi rnal 'byor ma dang rlung gi mtshams kyi rnal 'byor ma dang / me mtshams kyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la ba lang dang bong bu dang ce sbyang dang rnga mo'i pags pa'i sder sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi rnal 'byor ma dang bden bral phyogs kyi rnal 'byor ma dang rlung gi mtshams kyi rnal 'byor ma dang / me mtshams kyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la ba lang dang bong bu dang ce sbyang dang rnga mo'i pags pa'i sder sbyin par bya ste /
translated: To the yoginis of the northeast, southwest, northwest, and southeast, one should give the hides of the cow, donkey, hyena, and camel.

original: rang rang gi rigs shi ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rang rang gi rigs shi ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: They are the hides of those of one's own caste who have died.

original: 'di nyid du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid du yang gsungs pa /
translated: This very [tantra] also says:

original: cha gcig pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /🔽padma dum bu gcig pa dang / dum bu gnyis pa dang / dum bu gsum pa'am /
analyzed: cha gcig pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste / padma dum bu gcig pa dang / dum bu gnyis pa dang / dum bu gsum pa'am /
translated: One part, etc.🔽One should give to the yoginis a single-piece lotus, a two-piece lotus, a three-piece lotus,

original: ji ltar rnyed pa rnal 'byor ma rnams la btung ba'i don du sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rnyed pa rnal 'byor ma rnams la btung ba'i don du sbyin par bya'o //
translated: or whatever is available, for drinking.

original: de nas bza' ba sder du byin nas sgrub pa pos bskor ba lan gsum byas te /
analyzed: de nas bza' ba sder du byin nas sgrub pa pos bskor ba lan gsum byas te /
translated: Then, having given the food to the dish, the adept should circumambulate it three times.

original: dri dang me tog dang bdug spos la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod la yongs su bsngo ba bya ste /
analyzed: dri dang me tog dang bdug spos la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod la yongs su bsngo ba bya ste /
translated: Having worshipped it with perfumes, flowers, incense, and so forth, one should dedicate the merit:

original: bsod nams 'di yis sems can rnams thams cad phyag rgya chen po thob par gyur cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams 'di yis sems can rnams thams cad phyag rgya chen po thob par gyur cig ces pa'o //
translated: By this merit, may all sentient beings attain the Great Seal.

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo 'di rgyal pos bya ste /
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo 'di rgyal pos bya ste /
translated: This gaṇacakra should be performed by the king.

original: thun mong du ni sngags kyi stobs kyis sam lha'i nges pas so //
analyzed: thun mong du ni sngags kyi stobs kyis sam lha'i nges pas so //
translated: In common, it is by the power of mantra or by the deity's command.

original: gzhan du ni sgrub pa po rnams la bar chad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni sgrub pa po rnams la bar chad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be an obstacle for the adepts.

original: thun mong ba'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo ni yul dang rigs kyi tha snyad kyis bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don du bya ste /
analyzed: thun mong ba'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo ni yul dang rigs kyi tha snyad kyis bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don du bya ste /
translated: The common gaṇacakra is performed by the country and caste conventions for the purpose of accumulating merit.

original: rang gi rang rigs kyis smin pa'i rigs kyi bu mo rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rang gi rang rigs kyis smin pa'i rigs kyi bu mo rnams kyis so //
translated: The sons of one's own caste should be ripened by the girls of one's own caste.

original: gzhan du ni tshogs kyi 'khor lor mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni tshogs kyi 'khor lor mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be a gaṇacakra.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi bde ba byang chub kyi sems myang ba med par bza' ba dang btung ba 'ba' zhig pas ni dpa' bo'i ston mor brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi bde ba byang chub kyi sems myang ba med par bza' ba dang btung ba 'ba' zhig pas ni dpa' bo'i ston mor brjod par bya'o //
translated: The feast of the hero should be called that which is eaten and drunk only by the bodhicitta, the bliss of wisdom and means, without tasting the bodhicitta.

original: de yang slob dpon la sogs pa la dge bsnyen rnams kyis bya'o //
analyzed: de yang slob dpon la sogs pa la dge bsnyen rnams kyis bya'o //
translated: And that should be done by the lay practitioners to the master and so forth.

original: sngags kyi tshul 'dir slob dpon rnam pa gsum ste khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul dang dge slong chung du dang 'bring dang mchog go //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul 'dir slob dpon rnam pa gsum ste khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul dang dge slong chung du dang 'bring dang mchog go //
translated: In this mantra system, there are three types of masters: householders, novices, and fully ordained monks, who are lesser, middling, and supreme.

original: dge slong gnyis dag gi nang nas thog mar dbang bskur ba thu po dang / dge tshul gnyis kyi nang nas sngon la dbang bskur ba rgan pa dang / khyim pa gnyis kyi nang nas sngar dbang bskur ba gtso bo'o //
analyzed: dge slong gnyis dag gi nang nas thog mar dbang bskur ba thu po dang / dge tshul gnyis kyi nang nas sngon la dbang bskur ba rgan pa dang / khyim pa gnyis kyi nang nas sngar dbang bskur ba gtso bo'o //
translated: Among the two fully ordained monks, the one who was first ordained is senior. Among the two novices, the one who was first ordained is senior. Among the two householders, the one who was first ordained is senior.

original: de ltar rdo rje slob dpon thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo la shar du mngon par phyogs pa sbyin pa'i bdag pos tshogs kyi 'dren par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje slob dpon thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo la shar du mngon par phyogs pa sbyin pa'i bdag pos tshogs kyi 'dren par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the vajra master who holds the banner of omniscience should be seated in the east of the gaṇacakra by the patron.

original: dge slong gzhan rnams kyang rgan pa dang / gzhon pa'i rim pas de nas nye bar 'khod par @138a * //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan rnams kyang rgan pa dang / gzhon pa'i rim pas de nas nye bar 'khod par @138a * //
translated: The other bhikṣus should also be seated in order of seniority.

original: bya'o // de bzhin du byang du kha phyogs pas dge tshul gyi slob dpon gyi gral te /
analyzed: bya'o // de bzhin du byang du kha phyogs pas dge tshul gyi slob dpon gyi gral te /
translated: Similarly, in the north, facing south, is the row of the śrāmaṇera masters,

original: bden bral mtshams nas me'i mthar thug par ro //🔽dbang ldan nas rlung gi mthar thug par lhor kha phyogs pas rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i dbye bas khyim na gnas pa'i slob dpon gyi gral 'o //
analyzed: bden bral mtshams nas me'i mthar thug par ro // dbang ldan nas rlung gi mthar thug par lhor kha phyogs pas rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i dbye bas khyim na gnas pa'i slob dpon gyi gral 'o //
translated: from the southeast corner to the end of the fire direction.🔽From the northeast to the end of the wind direction, facing south, is the row of the householder masters, in order of seniority.

original: shar du dge slong ma dbang bskur ba rnams nub tu kha phyogs par rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i dbye bas nye bar 'khod par bya'o //
analyzed: shar du dge slong ma dbang bskur ba rnams nub tu kha phyogs par rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i dbye bas nye bar 'khod par bya'o //
translated: In the east, the bhikṣuṇīs who have received empowerment should be seated in the west, in order of seniority.

original: zhes so // bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa shar du bya'o //
analyzed: zhes so // bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa shar du bya'o //
translated: One should place the food, drink, and so on in the east.

original: dbus su rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor med na ba byung gi chu yis gru bzhi pa byas te /
analyzed: dbus su rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor med na ba byung gi chu yis gru bzhi pa byas te /
translated: If there is no maṇḍala of colored powders in the center, one should make a square with cow dung.

original: der dri dang me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: der dri dang me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa byas nas /
translated: Having made offerings there with perfume, flowers, and so on,

original: tshogs kyi bdag po'i g-yon du las kyi phyag rgya gcig gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: tshogs kyi bdag po'i g-yon du las kyi phyag rgya gcig gzhag par bya ste /
translated: one should place a karmamudra to the left of Gaṇapati.

original: tshogs kyi bdag po'i phyag rgya byas nas so //
analyzed: tshogs kyi bdag po'i phyag rgya byas nas so //
translated: Having made the mudra of Gaṇapati,

original: gzhan du na rnal 'byor ma med par tshogs kyi bdag pos btung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na rnal 'byor ma med par tshogs kyi bdag pos btung bar mi bya ste /
translated: otherwise, if there is no yoginī, Gaṇapati should not drink.

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo la dbang bskur ba'i sbyin pa'i bdag pos tshogs kyi bdag po la bsod nams 'phel ba'i don du phyag rgya mo nges par dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo la dbang bskur ba'i sbyin pa'i bdag pos tshogs kyi bdag po la bsod nams 'phel ba'i don du phyag rgya mo nges par dbul bar bya'o //
translated: The patron who is consecrated in the gaṇacakra must definitely offer a mudrā woman to Gaṇapati in order to increase merit.

original: gzhan du na sbyin pa'i bdag po la rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na sbyin pa'i bdag po la rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the patron will incur a root downfall.

original: dang po'i sangs rgyas su gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: dang po'i sangs rgyas su gsungs pa yang /
translated: The Ādibuddha declares:

original: chad ni shes rab rang bzhin sbrang rtsi dang bcas bu ram skyes sam 'bras skyes shing skyes te //
analyzed: chad ni shes rab rang bzhin sbrang rtsi dang bcas bu ram skyes sam 'bras skyes shing skyes te //
translated: The cut is the nature of wisdom, together with honey, born from sugarcane or rice.

original: phyag rgya dang bral 'thung byed gang de yul can du 'gyur bdud kyi tshogs kyis bskor de'i phyir //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang bral 'thung byed gang de yul can du 'gyur bdud kyi tshogs kyis bskor de'i phyir //
translated: He who drinks without the seal becomes the object, surrounded by the host of demons.

original: shes rab lhag ldan sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog cing sngags pa rnams la dngos grub sbyin par 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab lhag ldan sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog cing sngags pa rnams la dngos grub sbyin par 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, having superior wisdom, he takes away the stains of sin and grants spiritual powers to the mantrins.

original: phyag rgya gang su rung ba 'dir ni dam tshig rnams bral btung ba'i slad du rab tu bya //
analyzed: phyag rgya gang su rung ba 'dir ni dam tshig rnams bral btung ba'i slad du rab tu bya //
translated: Any seal whatsoever here is to be employed for the sake of drinking, being free from the commitments.

original: zhes so // gang du dge slong rdo rje 'dzin pa dag gi nang nas rgan pa rmongs pa dang gzhon pa ston pa po yin na der gzhon pa tshogs kyi bdag po rgan po rmongs pa ni khang pa gzhan du tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes so // gang du dge slong rdo rje 'dzin pa dag gi nang nas rgan pa rmongs pa dang gzhon pa ston pa po yin na der gzhon pa tshogs kyi bdag po rgan po rmongs pa ni khang pa gzhan du tshim par bya'o //
translated: Wherever the elder among the vajra-holders is confused, and the younger is the teacher, there the younger is the lord of the assembly, and the elder, being confused, should be satisfied in another house.

original: de ltar rim pas thams cad shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rim pas thams cad shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, by stages, everything should be known.

original: dge bsnyen ma dbang bskur ba ni nub tu mngon par phyogs pa ste dge slong ma'i gral bzhin no //
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma dbang bskur ba ni nub tu mngon par phyogs pa ste dge slong ma'i gral bzhin no //
translated: The consecration of the upāsikā is in the west, facing the east, like the row of bhikṣus.

original: tshogs kyi gtso mo'i g-yon du thabs sbyin pa'i bdag pos gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi gtso mo'i g-yon du thabs sbyin pa'i bdag pos gzhag par bya'o //
translated: To the left of the chief of the assembly, one should place the lord of generosity, the method.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na thabs med par tshogs kyi gtso mos myos byed dang sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na thabs med par tshogs kyi gtso mos myos byed dang sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: Otherwise, without the method, the chief of the assembly should not eat the wine and meat.

original: de nas tshogs kyi bdag po la sogs pa la g-yon skor du bza' ba dang ston mo dbul @138b bar bya zhing btung ba ni kham phor ram n'a ri ka la sogs pa'i snod du dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas tshogs kyi bdag po la sogs pa la g-yon skor du bza' ba dang ston mo dbul @138b bar bya zhing btung ba ni kham phor ram n'a ri ka la sogs pa'i snod du dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, beginning with the lord of the assembly, one should offer food and drink in a counterclockwise direction, and the drink should be offered in a vessel such as a bowl or a nālīka.

original: de nas myos byed la sogs pa sbyangs shing rgyas par byas la sbar nas bdud rtsir byas te /
analyzed: de nas myos byed la sogs pa sbyangs shing rgyas par byas la sbar nas bdud rtsir byas te /
translated: Then, having refined and expanded the wine, and so on, one should ignite it and transform it into nectar.

original: gtor ma la sogs pa phul nas /
analyzed: gtor ma la sogs pa phul nas /
translated: Having offered the bali, and so on,

original: 'chad par 'gyur pa'i bdud rtsi ril bus bsang gtor byas te lag pa g-yon pas aom yig gis sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur pa'i bdud rtsi ril bus bsang gtor byas te lag pa g-yon pas aom yig gis sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: one should perform the burnt offering with the nectar pill that will be explained, and one should purify it with the syllable oṃ in the left hand.

original: lag pa g-yas pas a'a: yig gis rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pas a'a: yig gis rgyas par bya'o //
translated: With the right hand, one should expand it with the syllable āḥ.

original: thal mo bkab nas h'um yig gis 'bar bar bya'o //
analyzed: thal mo bkab nas h'um yig gis 'bar bar bya'o //
translated: Having covered with the hollow hand, one should inflame it with the syllable hūṃ.

original: bya khyung gi phyag rgyas ho: yig gis bdud rtsir byas nas myos byed kyi thigs pas g-yon pa'i ming med kyi rtse mos sa gzhi la chos 'byung gru gsum pa dang / dbus su thig le zlum po byas nas de'i dbus su ye shes kyi 'khor lo shin tu dang ba lha'i bdag nyid gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa de tshim par bya ste /
analyzed: bya khyung gi phyag rgyas ho: yig gis bdud rtsir byas nas myos byed kyi thigs pas g-yon pa'i ming med kyi rtse mos sa gzhi la chos 'byung gru gsum pa dang / dbus su thig le zlum po byas nas de'i dbus su ye shes kyi 'khor lo shin tu dang ba lha'i bdag nyid gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa de tshim par bya ste /
translated: Having made it into nectar with the garuḍa mudra and the syllable hoḥ, one should delight the very clear divine nature of the wheel of pristine consciousness, which is like a reflection, with the tip of the left ring finger, on the ground, in a triangular source of phenomena, and in the center, a round bindu, with the drops of liquor.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshogs so //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshogs so //
translated: The assembly, which will be explained,🔽is delighted.

original: zhing skyong la sogs pa rnams kyi grong khyer dang grong gi ming gi yi ge mnyam pa rnams dang po dang mtha'i yi ge dag gis ming gi yi ge gnyis dang ming gi yi ge mi mnyam pa rnams kyi dang po dang bar dang mtha' rnams kyis yi
analyzed: zhing skyong la sogs pa rnams kyi grong khyer dang grong gi ming gi yi ge mnyam pa rnams dang po dang mtha'i yi ge dag gis ming gi yi ge gnyis dang ming gi yi ge mi mnyam pa rnams kyi dang po dang bar dang mtha' rnams kyis yi
translated: The two syllables of the name of those with equal syllables of the name of the city and town of the field protectors, and so on, are the first and last syllables. The three syllables of the name of those with unequal syllables of the name are the first, middle, and last syllables.

original: ge gsum ming du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ge gsum ming du 'gyur ro //
translated: The name is formed.

original: dang por aom yig dang bar du ming dang mthar a'a: h'um ste dper na /
analyzed: dang por aom yig dang bar du ming dang mthar a'a: h'um ste dper na /
translated: For example,

original: aom che ge mo a'a: h'um /
analyzed: aom che ge mo a'a: h'um /
translated: OM so-and-so AH HUM

original: ba lim gri hna gri hna sarba sa tv'a n'am ra ksham ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ba lim gri hna gri hna sarba sa tv'a n'am ra ksham ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: BALINGRIGHAN SARVASATTVANAM RAKSAM KURU SVAH

original: de bzhin du aom h'a r'i ti pi na da ke pra t'i tstsha kishim sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de bzhin du aom h'a r'i ti pi na da ke pra t'i tstsha kishim sv'a h'a /
translated: Likewise, OM HARITIPINADAKI PRATICHAKSHIN SVAH

original: 'phrog ma la chang bu gnyis so //
analyzed: 'phrog ma la chang bu gnyis so //
translated: For Harikela, two lumps.

original: aom du t'i ke aa gra gr'a sam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom du t'i ke aa gra gr'a sam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: OM DUTIKE AGRAGRASAM PRATICHAKSHIN SVAH

original: aom a'a: h'um gi sngags kyis bsngags par byas nas bza' bar 'gyur ba ji srid pa sa  la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um gi sngags kyis bsngags par byas nas bza' bar 'gyur ba ji srid pa sa  la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Having consecrated with the mantra OM AH HUM, one should place on the ground as much as will be eaten.

original: aom kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi au tstshi shta ba lim au tstshi stha bha ksha k'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi au tstshi shta ba lim au tstshi stha bha ksha k'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: OM KHA KHA KHAHI KHAHI UCCHISTAVALIM UCCHISTABHAKSHAYAKAYA SVAH

original: lhag ma'i gtor ma'i sngags so //
analyzed: lhag ma'i gtor ma'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra of the remainder offering.

original: 'di yang sngar gsungs pa'i 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang sngar gsungs pa'i 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
translated: This also should be given as the offering of all the previously mentioned spirits.

original: ji ltar rjes su mthun pa'i dus su thams cad so sor bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su mthun pa'i dus su thams cad so sor bya'o //
translated: At the appropriate time, everything should be done separately.

original: de nas slob dpon slob ma dang bcas pa thams cad kyis bza' ba dang btung ba bya'o //
analyzed: de nas slob dpon slob ma dang bcas pa thams cad kyis bza' ba dang btung ba bya'o //
translated: Then the master and the disciples should all eat and drink.

original: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig 'thab pa dang rtsod pa byed pa de gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig 'thab pa dang rtsod pa byed pa de gdon par bya'o //
translated: If there is any quarreling or disputing, that person should be expelled.

original: gang gi tshe dge slong dam dge tshul lam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dge slong dam dge tshul lam /
translated: If a bhikṣu or śrāmaṇera

original: khyim na gnas pa nga rgyal byed na de'i tshe nus pa dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa nga rgyal byed na de'i tshe nus pa dri bar bya'o //
translated: or a householder is arrogant, then their abilities should be tested.

original: gal te mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i nus pa ston par byed na de'i tshe de ni thams cad du thams cad kyi tshogs kyi gtso bo ste rnam pa gzhan du @139a * //
analyzed: gal te mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i nus pa ston par byed na de'i tshe de ni thams cad du thams cad kyi tshogs kyi gtso bo ste rnam pa gzhan du @139a * //
translated: If they demonstrate abilities such as supernormal knowledge, then they are the chief of the assembly in every way. Otherwise,

original: thos pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / dbang bskur gyis rgan pa'i nga rgyal gyis dge tshul lam khyim na gnas pa tshogs kyi 'dren par mi 'gyur gyi gang sngar dge slong yin pa de thams cad du tshogs kyi 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / dbang bskur gyis rgan pa'i nga rgyal gyis dge tshul lam khyim na gnas pa tshogs kyi 'dren par mi 'gyur gyi gang sngar dge slong yin pa de thams cad du tshogs kyi 'dren pa'o //
translated: they should not be the leader of the assembly. One who is arrogant about learning or arrogant about seniority due to empowerment should not be the leader of the assembly, whether a śrāmaṇera or a householder. Rather, one who is a bhikṣu first is the leader of the assembly in every way.

original: ci ste tshogs kyi 'khor lo la bton pa chad pa slong na de'i tshe bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa de las chad pa sbyin par bya ste tshogs kyi bdag pos so //
analyzed: ci ste tshogs kyi 'khor lo la bton pa chad pa slong na de'i tshe bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa de las chad pa sbyin par bya ste tshogs kyi bdag pos so //
translated: If someone is missing from the gaṇacakra, then the host of the gaṇacakra should give him food and drink, etc.

original: de ltar tshogs kyi 'khor lo la bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa la cho ga 'di thams cad du sbyin pa'i bdag pos bya'o zhes pa drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar tshogs kyi 'khor lo la bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa la cho ga 'di thams cad du sbyin pa'i bdag pos bya'o zhes pa drang ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the host of the gaṇacakra should give all of the food, drink, etc. in this way.

original: da ni nang gi tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga gsal bar bya ste gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: da ni nang gi tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga gsal bar bya ste gsungs pa yang /
translated: Now, the inner gaṇacakra will be clarified.

original: de 'di la yod pas na lhan skyes dga' ba'i gzugs can ma'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas na lhan skyes dga' ba'i gzugs can ma'o //
translated: she has that, therefore she has the form of innate joy.

original: dngos grub tu 'gyur ba ni de'i don du 'di 'dra ba'i phyag rgya btsal ba'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub tu 'gyur ba ni de'i don du 'di 'dra ba'i phyag rgya btsal ba'i dgos pa'o //
translated: One becomes successful, the purpose of seeking such a seal for that purpose.

original: dpal dri ma dang bral ba'i 'od du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal dri ma dang bral ba'i 'od du yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said in the Śrī-vimala-prabhā:

original: phyag rgya chen po ni chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid can /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ni chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid can /
translated: The great seal is the characteristic of all phenomena as lacking intrinsic nature,

original: rnams pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma sangs rgyas skyed par mdzad ma'o //
analyzed: rnams pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma sangs rgyas skyed par mdzad ma'o //
translated: endowed with the most sublime of all aspects, the perfection of wisdom, the producer of buddhas.

original: chos 'byung gi sgra yis brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: chos 'byung gi sgra yis brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be expressed by the sound of the source of phenomena.

original: chos 'byung de las chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin med par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chos 'byung de las chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin med par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: From that source of phenomena, all phenomena arise as lacking intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i chos rnams ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i chos rnams ni /
translated: The dharmas that are without intrinsic nature

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong rnams so //🔽zhes so // rten du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir de phyag rgya chen po zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong rnams so // zhes so // rten du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir de phyag rgya chen po zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: are the eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma, such as the powers and the fearlessnesses.

original: 'di nyid du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid du yang gsungs pa /
translated: And in this very tantra it is also said:

original: chos 'byung las skyes ye shes ni /
analyzed: chos 'byung las skyes ye shes ni /
translated: The wisdom born from the source of phenomena

original: mkha' mnyam thabs dang bcas par ldan //
analyzed: mkha' mnyam thabs dang bcas par ldan //
translated: is endowed with the method equal to space.

original: 'jig rten gsum po de las skyes //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po de las skyes //
translated: The three worlds are born from that.

original: shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin las //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin las //
translated: From the nature of wisdom and method,

original: zhes so // dpal tog rtse ba'i zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // dpal tog rtse ba'i zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
translated: The glorious Tipupa also says:

original: rdo rje 'dzin can dge ba'i sa //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin can dge ba'i sa //
translated: The one who holds the vajra is the virtuous

original: bcu gsum pa zhes rnam grags pa //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa zhes rnam grags pa //
translated: one known as the thirteenth.

original: gru gsum rnam par yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: gru gsum rnam par yang dag 'byung //
translated: The triangle arises perfectly.

original: chos 'byung zhes par de bshad do //
analyzed: chos 'byung zhes par de bshad do //
translated: It is explained as the source of phenomena.

original: zhes so // dpal kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud la rdo rje'i tshig gi snying po bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel du 'dul ba'i le'u ste brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: zhes so // dpal kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud la rdo rje'i tshig gi snying po bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel du 'dul ba'i le'u ste brgyad pa'o /
translated: In the commentary that condenses the essence of the Vajra Words of the glorious Hevajra Tantra, this is the eighth chapter, the chapter on taming.

original: // / da ni brtag pa dang por gsungs pa'i sngags rnams las kha cig btu ba'i le'u gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / da ni brtag pa dang por gsungs pa'i sngags rnams las kha cig btu ba'i le'u gsungs pa /
translated: Now, having taught the mantras in the first chapter, he teaches the chapter on the selection of some of them.

original: de nas 'di las zhes pa'o //🔽gang gi tshe gdul dka' ba sngar bshad pa'i tshul @141a * //
analyzed: de nas 'di las zhes pa'o // gang gi tshe gdul dka' ba sngar bshad pa'i tshul @141a * //
translated: Then, from this, he says.

original: gyis gdul bar mi nus pa de'i tshe nus pa bstan nas gdul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gyis gdul bar mi nus pa de'i tshe nus pa bstan nas gdul bar bya'o //
translated: When the difficult to tame are not able to be tamed by the previously explained method, then, having taught the ability, they should be tamed.

original: zhes pa rgyud de'i phyir kha sbyor 'byed pa'i cho ga bshad par bya'o zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: zhes pa rgyud de'i phyir kha sbyor 'byed pa'i cho ga bshad par bya'o zhes 'brel lo //
translated: This is the connection: therefore, the rite of separating the union should be explained.

original: kha sbyor 'byed pa'i cho ga yang bla ma'i man ngag las shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kha sbyor 'byed pa'i cho ga yang bla ma'i man ngag las shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The rite of separating the union should be known from the guru's instruction.

original: de skad du yang dpal sambu ta ru gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang dpal sambu ta ru gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, it is also said in the glorious Sambuta:

original: de nas rdo rje snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rab tu dga' zhing spyan gdangs nas 'dir the tshom rnams zhus pa /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rab tu dga' zhing spyan gdangs nas 'dir the tshom rnams zhus pa /
translated: Then, the bodhisattva mahasattva Vajra Heart and so forth, with great joy and wide open eyes, asked the questions here:

original: kha sbyor ci zhig brjod par bya //
analyzed: kha sbyor ci zhig brjod par bya //
translated: What is said to be the union?

original: kha sbyor shes rab thabs bdag nyid //
analyzed: kha sbyor shes rab thabs bdag nyid //
translated: The union is the nature of wisdom and means.

original: kha sbyor ni snyoms par 'jug pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: kha sbyor ni snyoms par 'jug pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Union is the state of union.

original: de las byung ba dang rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi'i kha sbyor gyi sgra yis rdo rje sems dpa' brjod par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de las byung ba dang rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi'i kha sbyor gyi sgra yis rdo rje sems dpa' brjod par bya'o zhes so //
translated: It should be understood that the term “union” in the context of the origin of all tantras refers to Vajrasattva.

original: dpal mngon par brjod pa phyi mar gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: dpal mngon par brjod pa phyi mar gsungs pa yang /
translated: The Shri-Malanirvana Tantra also says:

original: lte ba'i dbus su padma che //
analyzed: lte ba'i dbus su padma che //
translated: In the center of the navel is a great lotus,

original: skud pa bcu drug yang dag ldan //🔽yi ge la ni mnyam par sbyor //
analyzed: skud pa bcu drug yang dag ldan // yi ge la ni mnyam par sbyor //
translated: With sixteen channels perfectly complete.🔽The syllables are united in union,

original: kha sbyor byed pa bla na med //
analyzed: kha sbyor byed pa bla na med //
translated: The unsurpassed union.

original: de dbus rtag tu stong pa ni //
analyzed: de dbus rtag tu stong pa ni //
translated: In the center of that, always empty,

original: spro dang sdud pa byed pa can //
analyzed: spro dang sdud pa byed pa can //
translated: It creates emanation and re-absorption.

original: 'di ni rtag tu de nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ni rtag tu de nyid 'gyur //
translated: This is always reality,

original: rang 'byung thams cad khyab pa po //
analyzed: rang 'byung thams cad khyab pa po //
translated: The pervader of all self-arisen ones.

original: zhes so // de ltar gyur pa brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyis bdag nyid gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba rgyud kyi rgyal po gang gis 'byed par byed pa de kho na mtshon par bya zhes pa nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes so // de ltar gyur pa brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyis bdag nyid gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba rgyud kyi rgyal po gang gis 'byed par byed pa de kho na mtshon par bya zhes pa nges pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the root text is that the king of tantras that reveals that should be taught.

original: 'dir srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyis sam phyi rol dang nang gi bdag nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyis sam phyi rol dang nang gi bdag nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: Here, the commitments of killing and so forth are of two kinds: they are of provisional meaning and definitive meaning, or they are external and internal.

original: de la phyi rol du srog gcod par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni mtshams med pa lnga byed pa po rnams te /
analyzed: de la phyi rol du srog gcod par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni mtshams med pa lnga byed pa po rnams te /
translated: Regarding that, the Bhagavān taught that killing is external for those who commit the five heinous acts.

original: mtshams med pa lnga po de nyid sngon dang phyi mar shes nas so //
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga po de nyid sngon dang phyi mar shes nas so //
translated: Having understood those five heinous acts in terms of the past and future,

original: 'dir 'ga' zhig sngar mtshams med pa lnga byed pa'i ngang tshul can phyis bsod nams byed pa por 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir 'ga' zhig sngar mtshams med pa lnga byed pa'i ngang tshul can phyis bsod nams byed pa por 'gyur te /
translated: here, some who previously had the character of committing the five heinous acts later become doers of merit.

original: gtum po mya ngan med pa dang chos rgyal mya ngan med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gtum po mya ngan med pa dang chos rgyal mya ngan med pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the Aśoka Caṇḍa and the Aśoka Dharma King.

original: de'i phyir de la gnod pa byas pa las sngags pa dmyal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la gnod pa byas pa las sngags pa dmyal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the magician will go to hell due to harming them.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not understand virtuous and non-virtuous karma.

original: des na ji srid mngon par shes pa lnga can du ma gyur pa de srid du sngags pas zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang / dbang du bya ba dang dgug pa ma gtogs pa drag po'i las mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na ji srid mngon par shes pa lnga can du ma gyur pa de srid du sngags pas zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang / dbang du bya ba dang dgug pa ma gtogs pa drag po'i las mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, as long as he does not become one who possesses the five superknowledges, the magician should not perform wrathful actions except for pacifying, increasing, controlling, and summoning.
